Al-Shabaab has attacked a town near the Kenya-Somalia border and killed at least seven Somali soldiers.[84]
A Palestinian terrorist wounded three civilians in a car ramming attack near the settlement of Kiryat Arba in the West Bank. The perpetrator was killed.[85]
An Israeli soldier was stabbed in Hebron in the West Bank. He was evacuated to the hospital Jerusalem and treated for minor injuries. The perpetrator was shot and killed on the spot[85]

location: New York and New Jersey, United States
details: 2016 New York and New Jersey bombings: Around 9:30 am, a pipe bomb exploded in a trash can in Seaside Park, New Jersey, but no one was injured. Later that day, at around 8:30 pm, a homemade pressure cooker bomb exploded in the Chelsea neighborhood of Manhattan, injuring 29 people. A second pressure cooker bomb was promptly discovered four blocks away, but did not detonate. The following day, two homeless men discovered a backpack containing several pipe bombs, similar to the one that exploded in Seaside Park, in Elizabeth, New Jersey. On September 19, the perpetrator of the attacks, Ahmad Khan Rahami, was captured in Linden, New Jersey after a shootout with police forces which left three officers and Rahami wounded.
An Israeli soldier was stabbed in Hebron in the West Bank by a Palestinian man, who was shot and killed by Israeli forces.[86]
A roadside bomb killed 4 people and injured another 5 in Kapisa province.[87]
Insurgents from the terrorist group Al-Shabaab killed 7 Somali soldiers.[88]
Séléka rebels killed 26 civilians in a village in northern Central African Republic.[89]
2016 Uri attack: Seventeen Indian soldiers were killed by suspected rebels in an attack against a base in Indian Kashmir.[90]
An Israeli soldier was stabbed in Efrat, in the West Bank, by a Palestinian man, who was subsequently shot and wounded by Israeli forces.[91]
ISIS shot down a Syrian Air Force warplane, killing the pilot.[92]
A senior military official and four of his bodyguards were killed in Mogadishu, in a suicide attack claimed by the Al-Shabaab Islamists.[93]

ISIS executed four people after accusing them of cooperating with Iraqi forces, causing an airstrike that killed many of their senior commanders along with others.[94] They also executed another suspected spy by tying him to a pole and torturing him to death.[95]
Government spokesman says the two policemen were killed after facing heavy gunfire while patrolling the city.[96]
The Nigerian army has dispelled reports that 8 people were killed in an attack by Boko Haram fighters in Borno state.[97]
An assailant threw a Molotov cocktail at a Haitian radio station in Montreal, Canada. No casualties were reported in the attack. No one claimed responsibility for the incident.[99]

The Houthi forces, carried out a successful attack against the Saudi-led Coalition and Hadi loyalist.in the Lahj Governorate on Monday, killing and wounding several fighters from the latter. According to local activists, the Houthi forces and their allies carried out a powerful attack against the pro-regime groups at the outskirts of Kahbob in the Lahj Governorate.[100]
Three people were killed and five wounded in Baghdad on Monday by an improvised bomb that targeted a grocery store, Iraqi police and media said.[101]
A Palestinian wounded two Israeli police officers with a knife near Herod's Gate. He was shot and killed by security forces.[102]

ISIS closed all of the internet cafes in Mosul, and executed five employees for alledegly working with Iraqi forces, a part of their effort to cut off internet connection from areas under their control.[103] They also stoned a woman to death for "fornication".[104] They later executed six youths for "belonging to a resistance faction" using "welding tools".[105] A video also showed at least six people being executed by ISIS, and another man being shot dead in the head by a young boy.[106]
3 children were killed by a mine explosion in a school. A part of the school was destroyed, and many factions were angered at the lack of safety at the school.[107]

Three Ukrainian servicemen were wounded in action in the Donbass region on 19 September. The casualties occurred in the region of Avdiivka, where two servicemen were injured by explosion of a booby trap, the third received a gunshot wound.
A man tried to attack the Israeli embassy in Ankara with a knife while shouting 'Allahu akbar'. He was shot in the leg by a security guard and arrested.[108]
A bombing in the Tarmiya District in northern Baghdad targeted a Al-Hashd Al-Sha'abi patrol killing two and wounding four.[109]
Three people were killed, including one soldier, and four wounded when a car bomb exploded in Somali’s capital Mogadishu Wednesday afternoon, local officials said.[110]
Two rockets fired by Daesh wounded 9 people in Kilis.[111]

location: Beni, Democratic Republic of the Congo
details: At least 7 people were killed and 12 homes were set ablaze Thursday morning by suspected ADF rebels in a village located in the north eastern part of DR Congo. According to a senior police officer of Beni city, Ambrose Mboki, the attackers are suspected ADF rebels who for some years have been attacking villages neighboring the forests where they have bases.[112]
Three civilians were killed in Cameroon's Far North when a vigilante tried to stop a suicide bomber whose explosive device detonated.[113]
Three policemen were killed and two others wounded when a bomb exploded under their vehicle in Krong Pinang district, Yala, on Friday. It is one of many attacks lately in the south.[114]
A suicide bomber left 12 people dead and at least 30 injured.[115]

A series of shootings and a suicide car bombing at a checkpoint in Tikrit left 18 people dead and at least 21 injured. This was the first such attack in Tikrit since the city was recaptured from the Islamic State in April 2015.[116]
Islamic State executed 25 civilians for allegedly cooperating with Iraqi security forces.[117]
A gunman shot dead prominent Jordanian writer Nahed Hattar outside a court where he was facing charges for sharing a cartoon deemed offensive to Islam.[118]
A 'nail bomb' exploded in central Budapest injuring 2 police officers. The investigation into the explosion is still ongoing.[119][120]
A video showed the Islamic State executing at least 100 captured Iraqi civilians.[121]

Four soldiers and civilian JTF members died in Borno towns of Miyanti and Dareljamal after an ambush on the army by the insurgents
[122]
Boko Haram members attacked a Chad National Army position near the border with Niger. They killed four soldiers and injured six others.  Seven terrorist were killed too.[123]
A suspected Islamic State suicide bomber blew himself up amidst a group of Shiite pilgrims killing six and wounding eighteen.[124]

At least one civilian was killed and six others were injured Sunday after a bomb exploded in the north of the Sinai Peninsula in Egypt, as reported by the local state news agency MENA. According to these reports, the bomb has exploded on the road between the towns of Rafah, on the border with the Gaza Strip, and Sheikh Zuweid. For the moment, no group has claimed responsibility for the attack, but ISIS is suspected.[125]
11 children were injured by an unknown explosion and gas release.[126]
The Nigerian Army lost 1 officer and 3 soldiers to a landmine and ambush by the Boko Haram on Sunday.[127]
5 CRPF soldiers were injured in a grenade attack by militants in south Kashmir's Kulgam district today, police said.[128]
A bomb killed four Turkish soldiers and injured 10 others.[129]
Egyptian officials said Islamic State militants killed five Egyptian civilians and dumped their bodies, wearing orange jumpsuits, in a restive corner of the Sinai Peninsula.[130]
A Mali Military gard and his cousin were killed in their house by terrorists.[131]
The Nigerian Army has suffered fresh setbacks in the fight against terrorists and gunmen with several soldiers and support staff killed during separate incidents in Borno and Kaduna States.[132]
Two Afghan soldiers with suspected Taliban links killed at least 12 of their comrades as they slept in the volatile northern province of Kunduz.[133]
Unknown people set fire to a refugee home in Erbach, Baden-Württemberg.[134]

Two suicide bombings claimed the lives of at least fifteen people and wounded at least 52 others. A third bombing killed two cattle herders. Islamic State claimed responsibility for the two suicide bombings but the third bombing went unclaimed.[135]
At least three people, one soldier and two civilians were injured in a shooting, there is a detainee.[136]
Three policemen and a civilian had been killed in the shooting attack.[137]
Islamic State members failed to successfully carry out a suicide attack do to an explosive belt malfunction. 16 militants were killed and 16 were injured.[138]
Islamic State executed 15 civilians in Deir ez-Zor district[139]
An Israeli soldier was stabbed in Kalandia, in the West Bank, by a Palestinian man, who was subsequently shot and killed by Israeli forces.[140]

Joachim Kebschull, the mayor of the German town of Oersdorf, was beaten unconscious with a stick while walking to a town hall meeting. The attack is believed to be in retaliation for his plans to accommodate refugees in Oersdorf.[141]
A car exploded after the passage of the general prosecutor car. One civilian was wounded.[142]
A car exploded outside a restaurant in Mogadishu. The blast killed at least two people.[1]
Islamic State militants have killed five Egyptian police conscripts.[2]
The jihadist rebel group, Jund al-Aqsa, executed two men and killed a woman in Al-Lataminah in the Hama Countryside at a house.[3]
An improvised explosive device exploded in the Industrial Neighborhood in Basmaya area, southeast of Baghdad, killing two persons and wounding nine other with several injuries.[4]
Four workers in an electrical company were killed and three of their colleagues were injured when the vehicle transporting them to work hit an IED in the west of Al Arish city in North Sinai.[5][6]
The 2 October strike outside Irbil killed two Kurdish peshmerga fighters and wounded two French Special Operations troops, according to the report. One of the soldiers is critically injured.[7]
Three rockets fired from an Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant controlled region in Syria hit the border province of Kilis on 2 October, state-run Anadolu Agency has reported.[8]
Jeroen Oerlemans was killed by an Islamic State sniper in Sirte. Jeroen was a photographer and war correspondent who reports mainly from Afghanistan and the Near East[9]
One Indian soldier killed and four others wounded after an attack on an army camp in Baramulla.[10]
An improvised explosive device exploded in Darzab District, killing six people and wounding 40 others.[11]
One Blue helmets was killed and several others wounded in an attack on their base in Aguelhok, Mali.[12]
A suicide bombing killed at least twenty people in Al-Hasakah during a Kurdish wedding.[13]
At least 16 were killed and dozens of others injured in three bombings in Baghdad.[14]
At least four women were killed and one injured when unidentified assailants opened fire on a bus.[15]

Suspected members of the Army guerrilla National Liberation (ELN) blew up on Tuesday a section of the Cano Limon-Covenas, which transports crude from the Colombian department of Arauca, on the northeastern border with Venezuela, to the Caribbean coast, the military said.[16]
A US soldier was killed by a bomb blast while on patrol during operations in Nangarhar Province in Afghanistan.[17]

Fierce gun battles raged for a second day on Tuesday in Afghanistan's embattled northern city of Kunduz while in the country's south, insurgents killed 12 policemen at checkpoints around the Helmand provincial capital and seized another district they had attacked a day earlier.[18]
At least 20 people were wounded in a suicide attack on a mini bus carrying Ministry of Mines workers in capital Kabul on Wednesday.[19]

Two soldiers were killed and three were wounded in a shootout against PKK militants against a military base in the town of Lice in the Turkish province of Diyarbakir. Moreover, one of two people who gathered with militants in the forest area of Sehi, in Bitlis, was killed in the air operation, and another was injured.[20]

2016 stabbing of Brussels police officers: On 5 October 2016, three police officers were attacked by a man wielding a machete in the Schaerbeek neighborhood of Brussels, Belgium. Two of them suffered stab wounds, while the third was physically assaulted but otherwise uninjured. However, their injuries are not believed to be life-threatening. Several stations in Brussels and the anti-terrorism prosecution office was also evacuated due to an ongoing bomb-alert. Many businesses were closed and there was major travel disruption.[21]
An improvised explosive device killed one member of the al-Hashd al-Shaabi and wounded four more.[22]
Gunmen have kidnapped in the Libyan capital, Tripoli, a nearby cleric Grand Mufti of the country, Sadik Ghariani, without knowing who were the authors.[23]
An al-Shabaab attack on a village near the Kenyan town of Mandera results in six deaths.[24]
The Malian refugee camp Tazalit in the Tasara region was attack by forty assailants, presumably AQIM,.Twenty people were killed (all site security forces). One refugee was injured.[25]
A suicide bomber blew himself up in a border town with Turkey killing at least 29 opposition fighters[26]
October 2016 Istanbul bombing: An explosion, which was caused by a car bomb near a police station in Istanbul making 10 injured.[27][28]
A soldier was killed in a PKK bomb attack in eastern Turkey's Van Province.[29]
An improvised explosive device killed three member of the al-Hashd al-Shaabi and wounded seven more.[30]
At least six people were killed Thursday in an attack executed by the Taliban in the Afghan village of Darzab, located in the province of Jowzjan (northwest).[31]
Right-wing extremists mistreat Syrian refugee children, three were injured.[32]
At least six people have been killed and 19 wounded after two explosions targeted a passenger train in Pakistan's southwestern Balochistan province.[33]
A gunman shot dead an imambargah trustee and critically injured his son.[34]
A policeman was killed, while another constable and a civilian were injured when some terrorists fired at a security post guarding minority community in Shopian district of Kashmir.[35]
The train, consisting of two locomotives and ten wagons, came under fire in the Muriza area,three crew members and three policemen were in the lead locomotive which was hit by the gunfire.[36]
Five police conscripts were killed on Friday night in an explosion caused by an improvised explosive device.[37]
Two suicide bombers blew themselves up in Ankara in response to calls by police for them to surrender. There were no further casualties except for the bombers.[38]

ISIS used three suicide car bombs in the attack, which resulted in casualties, including two officers, in the brigades based in the Ragih area west of Qayyara, al Jazeera reported, citing military sources.[39]
Two U.S. servicemembers were wounded when the vehicle they were traveling in hit a roadside bomb.[40]
An Afghan official says at least three police officers have been killed in an attack in southern Kandahar province.[41]
Three children were killed and another four wounded in the Shah Wali Kot district after a bomb they found exploded.[41]

A lone wolf attacker entered a shopping mall in Minsk, before proceeding to attack at least two women with a chainsaw and an axe. One of the victims died; while another sustained critical injuries and remains in hospital. The perpetrator remains unknown to police.[42]
A bombing targeting Shiites in Baghdad killed at least five people and wounded 21.[43]

2016 Jerusalem shooting: A Palestinian lone wolf attacker arrived at a tram stop in his car and shot "randomly" at passers-by. A 60-year-old woman and a police officer were killed; the attacker himself was pursued by police and later shot dead. At least 6 other injuries were incurred and the attack is believed to be a "terrorist incident".[44]
2016 Şemdinli bombing: A bomb killed at least 18 people including 8 civilians and 10 soldiers and another 27 people were wounded.[45]

About 25 Saudis killed in a military raid Houthis in Saudi Arabia
At least 25 Saudi soldiers have died in a raid by Huthi militia and its allies near the town of Jizan, on the southwestern tip of Saudi Arabia, as reported by the Yemeni news agency Saba, akin to the Huthi.[46]

location: Beni, Democratic Republic of the Congo
details: A rebel attack in the northeastern Democratic Republic of Congo town of Beni has killed at least 11 people.[47]
Eight militants who were planning attacks in Chechnya were killed in a shootout with police. Four officers were injured as well.[48]
A military helicopter has crashed in Afghanistan's northern Baghlan province, killing all eight people on board, officials have told Al Jazeera.[49]

A negotiator for the main opposition party, Mozambican National Resistance (Renamo) in the peace process with the Government of Mozambique was shot dead in Maputo, local media reported today citing police sources.[50]

Islamic State militants detonated an explosive device adjacent to the army convoy as it passed near Tamalous town in northeastern Algeria. It was not immediately clear whether the explosion caused any casualties.[52]

Indian security forces have been battling a group of fighters inside a government compound in the Indian-administered portion of Kashmir, according to local police sources. Residents, who spoke to Reuters from some of the few locations in the city that have phone service, said the plotters were killed by drowning and their bodies were buried in a mass grave in a wasteland on the outskirts of the city.[78]
An Islamic State attack has left at least 12 people dead at a security checkpoint in Egypt, marking a possible spread of violence on the Sinai peninsula.[79]

An American aid worker has been kidnapped in a town northeast of Niger's capital Niamey, before being taken by his abductors to Mali, according to a security source.Armed men raided the house of the aid worker on Friday, killing his two guards before driving him off across the desert, the mayor of the town of Abalak said on Saturday.[80][81]

At least six people, including a soldier were killed and 20 others were injured in a spate of attacks across Baghdad on Sunday. Iraqi Lt. Hatim al-Jabouri told Anadolu Agency a bomb attack in southeast Baghdad targeted a patrol vehicle, killing a soldier and injuring four others. In another attack in a central neighborhood in Baghdad, three civilians were killed and seven others were injured, al-Jabouri said. In a bomb attack close to a market area in Yusufiyye town in Baghdad, two people were killed and nine others were injured. There was no claim of responsibility for Wednesday’s violence, but the Iraqi authorities typically blame such attacks on the Daesh terrorist group.[125]
A car bomb killed 3 children and 20 others people were injured. The attack occurred in Benghazi.[126]

Six soldiers were killed in an attack on a military base, while the surrounding houses were burned. On the other hand, a woman with explosives tried to enter an army post next to the Kolofata camp on Monday, but was shot down.[127]
A bomb killed one and another 3 were wounded. The attack occurred in Chaman.[128]
A bomb killed 3 officers and another 5 were wounded. The attack occurred in Peshawar.[129]

November 2016 Israel wildfires: 50,000 people were evacuated from the city of Haifa, and surrounding towns, after "political arsonists" set fires in forests and wild habitats surrounding urban areas. At least 130 people have been admitted to the hospital.[130]
A member of Islamic State killed a colonel.[131]
Insurgents killed four security forces in Port Harcourt.[132]
At least two persons were killed in a suicide bomb attack in Maiduguri.[133]
Islamic State killed at least 6 civilians and another 30 were injured.[134]
A security guard at Khuan Ran School in Sabayoi district was shot dead by motorcycle gunmen on Thursday morning.[135]
3 Turkish soldiers were killed and 7 others wounded in an attack by Islamic State militants near the northern Syrian city of al-Bab.[136]
A U.S. service member was killed by an improvised explosive device in northern Syria.[137]
A car bomb blew up near the governor's office in the city of Adana. At least two people were killed and twenty others injured.[138]
A bomb killed one person in Anbar.[139]

location: North Kivu, Democratic Republic of Congo
details: Police accuse militiamen have killed four policemen in North Kivu. According to the chief police chief in northern Kivu, Van Kasongo, two policemen were killed and two others in Butembo in Rutshuru.[140]
November 2016 Hillah suicide truck bombing: A truck bomb killed at least 125 people in Hillah city 95 others are injured.[141]

Two young female suicide bombers attacked a town in Cameroon's far north region early on Thursday.One of the bombs exploded in Mora, killing the girl and wounding at least four people.Locals killed the second bomber before her device detonated.[142]
Eight Egyptian soldiers were killed during a car bombing in Arish. After this first attack, four other soldiers dies during a gunfight. Three terrorists were also killed during the clash[143]
Two Russian special forces and two suspected militants are killed in a gunfight in Nazran, Ingushetia.[144]
At least five people, including a Turkish soldier were killed in an attack.[145]
Multiple bomb killed at least six people and injured 27 others. The explosions occurred in Jalalabad City.[146]
Two soldiers were killed when several militants attempted to enter a mosque in Northern Pakistan. Two of the militants were killed by gunfire while the other two detonated their suicide vests.[147]
Four people were killed and several houses burned down by unknown militants in the Mile One village of Tafan District, Kaduna State.[148]

Two days of fighting between armed groups in Central African Republic have left 16 people dead, including civilians, while 10,000 have fled their homes, the UN peacekeeping mission Minusca has said.[149]
Islamic State mortars kill 16 Iraqi civilians in Mosul.[150]
November Mogadishu car bombing: At least 20 people were killed by the explosion of a car bomb near a market in the Somali capital Mogadishu.[151][152]

The PKK targeted a Turkish soldier's family with a roadside bomb in southeastern Şırnak Province's Uludere district, killing a man and seriously injuring another man. The family members were visiting the soldier who was serving at the Kuresin military base.[153]

Special Forces personnel of the Indian Army were on Saturday injured in an ambush by militants in Chandel district of Manipur. Army sources said an IED blast was triggered during a combing operation by the commandos.[154]
perpetrator: United Liberation Front of Western South East Asia (Suspected)

details: Muslim insurgents killed an eight-month-pregnant Buddhist woman and injured another in a drive-by shooting in Pattani Saturday night, another woman was injured.[155]
Two security guards were killed when militants opened fire on a vehicle of a private oil exploration company in Pasni area of Gwadar district.[156]

November 2016 Butig clash: The Maute Group briefly seized control of parts of Butig town in Lanao del Sur, in retaliation of an offensive launched by the Armed Forces of the Philippines. Government forces killed at least 63 militants and recaptured the town.
Two persons were injured when a homemade bomb exploded in front of the gate of a Catholic church in Esperanza, Sultan Kudarat province.[157][158]
A bomb exploded outside a police station. No one was injured.[159]

A blast ripped through a street in the northern Syrian town of al-Rai in what was believed to be an Islamic State suicide bombing, with several deaths reported and security and hospital sources saying 12 wounded, mostly children.[160]
Islamic State militants have fired a rocket in northern Syria that caused symptoms of "chemical gas" exposure in 22 Syrian rebels.[160]
IDF forces came under an ambush by Islamic State militants. Four terrorists were killed while there were no casualties among the IDF forces.[161]
Separatist assaillants linked with the king Charles Mumbere attaked a police station in Kasese.[162][163]

location: Lubero Territory, Democratic Republic of the Congo
details: 30 civilians were killed in an attack by ethnic Nande militias in eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo.[164]
Insurgents from Taliban militants group killed 4 border policemen. The attack occurred on 27 November in Zabul Province.[165]
A bomb killed at least three people and another five were injured in two attacks.[166]
An officer of the Burma Army and two Burma Army soldiers were killed by the blast mines in the recent conflict zone near the Kyone Htaw waterfall, Mae Tha Wor, Karen State confirm authorities.[167]
An explosion killed at least two policemen.[168]
Insurgents from Taliban terrorist group killed twelve policemen. Other sources said that three policemen and ten insurgents died in the attack.[169]
Philippine police safely detonated an improvised explosive device (IED) found in a trash can meters away from the US Embassy in Manila.[170]
Insurgents shoot dead one and another were injured. The attack occurred in Silvan.[171]

2016 Ohio State University attack: A man named Abdul Razak Ali Artan rammed his car into a group of students at the Ohio State University. The perpetrator then proceeded to stab several others with a knife. Artan was killed on scene and was confirmed to be an OSU student and Somali refugee. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.  Law enforcement officials stated that Artan was inspired by terrorist propaganda from the Islamic State and Muslim cleric Anwar al-Awlaki.[172]
2016 Nagrota army base attack: Rebels launch an attack on an Indian Army base in the town of Nagrota. At least 7 soldiers and 3 insurgents die in the attack.[173]
An explosion killed at least one and injured another six in Baghdad.[174]
A bomb killed at least 4 Somali soldiers and another 11 were injured.[175]
At least 12 Christian farmers were killed in four villages in Kaduna state, Nigeria in a fresh spate of what Christian leaders described as an ethno-religious cleansing.[176]
Insurgents killed with a sniper at least 15 children.[177] In al-Bakr district a mortar shells killed at least 3 people and another 3 were wounded.[178]
Two members of the engineering teams were killed by Islamic State militants.[1]
Four bombs killed two people and injured another seven in Sha'ab, a neighbourhood of Baghdad.[2]
A five-year-old girl from the Embera indigenous community died. Her mother was also injured.[3]
Insurgents killed at least one person.[4]
One soldier was killed and three others were injured Wednesday in an early morning explosion in south Thailand.[5]

Several women committed suicide bombings that killed four Libyan soldiers and two other women. The victims had previously granted them safe passage to leave buildings under the control of Islamic State militants.[6]
Four men were executed by Islamic State.[7]

The Taliban executed a fourth-year student of Kabul Polytechnic University in Sewaka village, 60 km from Kabul. Faiz ul Rahman Wardak was accused of being involved of the assassination of a Taliban intelligence officer, Mullah Mirwais, and was hanged for this accusation.[8]
Two soldiers were killed and eight others were injured, when a group of militants opened fire on a convoy.[9]
At least 24 people were killed in an attack by the Islamic State militant group in the Iraqi city of Mosul on Saturday.[10]
At least two persons were shot dead by unidentified armed men riding a motorcycle in Lond Khor area of Mardan.[11]
The Islamic State executed 11 persons, including a whole family, for trying to flee its areas.[12]
Islamic State executed a homosexual man in the city of Aleppo.[13]
Terrorists launched two suicide vehicles towards army lines. 9 soldiers were killed.[14]
Insurgent shoot dead one soldier.[15]
A bomb kills at least 3 civilians in Jumuma, a village in Paktika Province.[16]
A CRPF trooper was killed and another wounded as Maoists set off three Improvised Explosive Device (IED) blasts and fired at separate places in Chhattisgarh's Bastar on Tuesday.[17]
Al-Qaeda militants attacked a prison. Two guards were injured. Dozens of prisoners have escaped.[18]

A soldier was killed while a policeman was wounded in separate clashes between government forces and suspected members of the Maute group in Butig, Lanao del Sur, a military official said Tuesday.[19]

location: Pattani Province and Narathiwat Province, Thailand
details: Suspected insurgents shot dead six people in a series of attacks carried out Tuesday and Wednesday in south Thailand.[20]
An Islamic State suicide bomber blew himself up near a hospital, killing 20 soldiers.[21]
Terrorists launched a "double-tap" car bombing outside the Benghazi headquarters of Saiqa Special Force. The two blasts appear to have killed nobody outright but left 22 people injured.[22]
Islamic State group jihadists killed at least 26 members of Syrian government forces today in an assault on regime positions in the central province of Homs.[23]
Separate bombings in the Iraqi capital killed 10 people and wounded another 22.[24]
Six police officers and a civilian were killed in a bombing near a checkpoint in the Egyptian capital. Three additional officers and four civilians were wounded by the blast.[25][26]
Madagali suicide bombings: Officials say 2 explosions in Madagali a town Nigeria have killed 57 and injured 177.[27]
A civilian died and another 3 were injured in bombing attack.[28][29]
At least 4 civilians die in shooting in Parwan Province.[30]
A bomb killed at least 2 people in Somalia.[31]
Three members of Abu Sayyaf, including a leader, were killed in a shooting between the police and the militant. The shooting occurred in Malaysia.[32]
Insurgents killed one officer in Peshawar.[33][34]
December 2016 Aden suicide bombings: 50 Yemeni soldiers were killed and another 70 were injured in a suicide bombing attack.[35]
December 2016 Istanbul bombings: Two bombs killed 44 and injured at least 155 people in Istanbul.[36]
Islamic State militants executed an Iraqi journalist in central Mosul.[37]
Boko Haram Attack Leaves 3 Dead and 17 Injured in Borno.[38]
At least three people in separate shootings in Quetta.[39]
Four border patrol police officers were hospitalized in south Thailand on Monday, when a remote controlled bomb exploded near their vehicle.[40]
December 2016 Mogadishu suicide bombing: At least 29 people died and another 50 were injured in a suicide bombing attack on a police station near Mogadishu's port.[41]
Botroseya Church bombing: At least 27 people were killed and 47 injured after an explosion in a Coptic cathedral in Cairo.[42][43]
3 people were killed in two suicide bombing attack in Maiduguri.[44]
Two car bombing kills at least 8 people in Fallujah.[45]
5 people were executed by Islamic State militants.[46]
11 men were executed, al Qaeda were suspected.[47]
At least four people were killed and 10 injured in a bomb blast in Kismayo, south of Mogadishu.[48]
A bomb killed one and another 3 were injured in North Waziristan.[49]
A military vehicle struck a roadside bomb during a security swoop in North Sinai's city of Sheikh Zuweid, killing four soldiers.[50]
A senior commander of the Afghan Border Police forces was killed in an explosion in eastern Kunar province.[51]

The Islamic State terror group claimed that it was responsible for firing two missiles on Monday from the Sinai Peninsula, aimed at an Israeli border crossing with Egypt but which missed the mark and landed in Egyptian territory.[52]
Three people were killed in hand grenade attacks on a restaurant Sunday evening in southern Somalia, police confirmed on Monday.[53]
Nine people were injured on Monday when suspected militants attacked the office of National Party (NP) in Balochistan's Turbat district, police officials said.[54]

An explosive device was discovered and defused outside the Labor Ministry in Athens, Greece. Group of Popular Fighters claimed responsibility for the incident. Authorities also attributed the attack to the Conspiracy of Cells of Fire.[55][56]
A bomb kills 3 civilians and another 2 were wounded in Zabul Province.[57]
A ring of bombings in federal offices and banks were reported in the city of Oaxaca.Brigada de Acción Informal Bruno Filippi claimed responsibility for the explosions in a release.[58][59]
perpetrator: Brigada de Acción Informal Bruno Filippi

details: 16 civilians were executed by Islamic State militants.[60]
Boko Haram militants attacked a military base in Borno state village of Kamuya leaving scores dead.[61]
Two people died and 23 were injured when unknown assailants threw a grenade into a bar early Tuesday in Colombia's most southwestern city, Tumaco.[62]
perpetrator: National Liberation Army Or Clan del Golfo (suspected)

details: A policeman died Tuesday during an operation in the town of Apachita in Vraem region.[63]
75 civilians were executed by Islamic State militants.[64]

At least three policemen killed, nine injured in military ambush. The first ambush occurred at Lokchao, 21 km from the border town of Moreh and the second ambush took place at Bongyang area of the same district.[65]
A civilian was wounded on Wednesday when two IEDs exploded in central Baghdad.[66]
Two police officers, and a 12-year-old boy were stabbed in the head with a screwdriver.[67]
Two Colombian policemen were killed in an ELN guerrilla attack in the town of Saravena, Arauca department (border with Venezuela), confirmed that institution.[68]
Two policeman (another was seriously injured)and four other narcoterrorist died after a clash in the Vraem region, known for hosting remnants of Sendero Luminoso and the high traffic of drugs.[69]
The Islamic State execute a young Peshmerga fighter.[70]
A bombing at a Mogadishu tea shop left at least 5 Somali soldiers dead.[71]
Three people have been killed in a bomb attack at a police station in the Syrian capital, Damascus.[72]
At least five people have been wounded Thursday in a suicide car bomb attack targeting a Mogadishu restaurant regularly frequented by journalists, according to authorities and eyewitnesses.[73]
2016 Nassoumbou attack: Several dozen heavily armed gunmen attacked an army outpost near the border with Mali, leaving at least 12 soldiers dead and 2 others missing.[74]
Insurgents from Taliban group killed one in Kabul Province.[75]
Terrorist shoot dead one in Logar Province.[76]
Assailants set fire to a Muslim prayer hall in Chateau-Thierry, Hauts-de-France, France. The prayer hall was damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.[77]
Five female security staff and their driver were killed by unknown gunmen near Kandahar Airport.[78]
2016 Kayseri bombing: A suspected car bombing killed 14 soldiers aboard a bus and wounded at least 55 others.[79]

Four militants attacked a policeman, seized his car, and ran over another policeman who tried to stop the vehicle, killing him.[80][81] Other police officers opened fire at the militants and liquidated them.[82] ISIL claimed responsibility for the attack.[83]
A member of the civilian Joint Task Force (JTF) was injured during operations against Boko Haram.[84]
Eight African Coalition Forces were killed by Boko Haram militants.[85]
Insurgents killed at least 3 soldiers in Pampore.[86]
Shooting left at least six people dead.[87]
An Islamic State suicide bomber carries out a car bomb attack on Iraqi forces.[88]
A rocket-propelled grenade was on Sunday launched on a civilian minibus in southern Somalia, killing six people, in Lower Shebelle.[89]
December 2016 Aden suicide bombings: At least 52 Yemeni soldiers collecting their salaries at a base in northeast Aden were killed when a suicide bomber detonated.[90]

2016 Al-Karak attack: Insurgents attacked police and civilians in Al-Karak, Jordan, then took shelter in the Kerak Castle. 12 people were killed and 35 were injured, most of whom were Jordanian security forces and civilians. A Canadian tourist was also killed.[91]
At least seven people were killed and eight wounded when a suicide bomber targeted forces loyal to Libya's eastern government in Benghazi.[92]
A car bombing attack kills one soldier from Turkey in al-Bab city.[93]
An Islamic State militant beheads an Afghan militiaman working with the SAA at the T4 Military Airport near Homs, Syria.[94]
Insurgent shoot dead 3 people and another 3 were injured.[95]
Two soldiers were shot dead in an attack perpetrated by members of the ELN, close of the location of Arauca, in the Northern.[96]
A bomb killed 1 and another 22 were injured in Kunduz.[97]
2 people die in bombing attack.[98]

Three Ukrainian soldiers were killed and four others wounded in a new clash with units of the People's Militia (MP) of the self-proclaimed People's Luhansk People's Republic (RPL), which took place in the area of Debáltsevo, RIA Novosti MP of the RPL, Andrei Marochko.[99]

Mai Mai militiamen on Monday morning killed a UN peacekeeper during an attack on Butembo town in North Kivu province, in the eastern part of the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC). Two peacekeepers were also injured in the attack while five militia fighters were also killed and two others captured, according to police.[100]

Assassination of Andrei Karlov: A gunman killed Russian ambassador in Turkey and three bystanders were also injured.[101] According to the Egyptian newspaper Al-Youm Al-Sabea, the Army of Conquest claimed responsibility for the assassination.[102]

At least three minors belonging to the indigenous community E'ñepá were killed after being hit by the explosion of a fragmentary grenade in the town of Caicara del Orinoco, located in the municipality of Cedeño in the northeast of the state of Bolívar. The explosion of the object also left two wounded, identified as Juana Torres Luciani of 19 years and a minor of 8 years.[103]
Bombings killed 1 and another 8 were injured.[104]

2016 Berlin attack: 12 people have died after a truck ploughed into a Christmas market in Berlin, German police have said. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.[105][106] On 21 December, police announced a nationwide search for a specific suspect, after personal documents of a Tunisian man, apparently a notice for temporary stay in Germany, were found in the lorry's cab. Later that day the police announced that it had been stepped up to a Europe-wide search. According to investigators, the suspect entered Germany from Italy in 2015 and belonged to a Salafist network with the name True Religion, around recently interred Abu Walaa, who was known as a recruiter for the Islamic State in Germany.[107] The perpetrator was found by police in Milan, Italy four days later and was killed in a shootout with police. One officer was wounded.[108]
Four fishing boat crew were reportedly abducted off Sulu.[109]

An assailant opened fire outside the United States embassy in Ankara, Turkey. There were no reported casualties in the attack, and the assailant was arrested at the scene. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.[110]
A shooting by Al Shabaab terrorist group left one dead in Puntland.[111]
A twin bomb attack on the headquarters of an Iranian Kurdish party based in northern Iraq has killed seven people.[112]
A Canadian and a Briton were killed by Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant near Raqqa.[113][114]
Eight people are killed and another six were injured in a Taliban attack on Afghan Member of Parliament Mir Wali's home in Helmand Province.[115][116]
Six gunmen on motorcycles attacked Saye's military soldier and shot the gendarmes on the scene, one soldier was killed and several were wounded.[117]
Three suicide car bombings kills at least 23 people in Mosul.[118]
Part of Battle of al-Bab: the death toll of Turkish soldiers in Syria's Al-Bab has increased to 16, Defense Minister Fikri Isik said on Thursday.[119]
At least three Policemen were injured in an ELN guerrilla attack in the department of Cesar (north), which also killed a guerrilla.[120]
Two Turkish soldiers were burned to death in the Aleppo countryside.[121]

Afriqiyah Airways Flight 209: A commercial jet that took off from Libya was reportedly hijacked by individuals with explosives. The plane has landed in Malta. The hijackers were pro-Gaddafi militants and belonged to the Brigade 93 militant group and demanded the recognition of their group.[122]
Insurgents shoot dead seven and another six were injured.[123]
A 50-year-old man was lightly wounded in a stabbing attack outside his home in the West Bank.[124]

Islamic State executed a man in Syria's northeastern Raqqa city on charges of smuggling citizens to areas beyond the group's contro and two Western soldiers in Syria's northeastern Raqqa city.[125][126]
Car bombs have killed more than 30 people.[127]
At least 11 policemen were killed.[128]
Insurgents kills 4 policemen.[129]

One soldier was killed and another wounded in a shootout of suspected guerrillas from the National Liberation Army (ELN, guevarista) in a rural area of the department of Arauca, eastern Colombia, was officially reported Saturday.[130]
A Frenchwoman was abducted in the city of Gao.[131]
Insurgents kills one policemen and another four were injured.[132]
10 people were killed in a series of attacks in Mosul.[133]
At least 16 people, including a police officer, were injured in a blast outside a Catholic church in the southern Philippines.[134]

location: North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo
details: At least 13 people were killed in shooting and stabbing by insurgents in the Democratic Republic of the Congo.[135]
Separate bombings in and around Baghdad have killed at least 11 civilians and wounded 34 others.[136]
A suicide bombing attack left at least 2 people dead and injured 5 others in Mora.[137]
A roadside bomb has killed at least two civilians in Afghanistan's eastern Laghman Province.[138]
A suicide bombing attack killed one police in Lashkargah.[139]
A bomb killed 1 and 6 others were injured in Kasra district. A blast left 1 dead.[140]
Islamic State kills at least 30 people in al-Bab.[141]
Two suicide bombers struck in Maiduguri.Only one of the attackers was said to have died, as the other was reportedly captured before striking.[142]
Islamic State group executed seven civilians for collaborating with security forces.[143]
7 civilians were killed and 3 wounded in the explosion of a booby-trapped vehicle.[144]
A woman has reportedly been beheaded by a group of armed men in Afghanistan after she entered a city without her husband.
An explosion killed a local official in Lebanon.[145]
One soldier was killed on Dec. 28 during clashes with outlawed Kurdistan Workers’ Party (PKK) militants in the eastern province of Tunceli, Doğan News Agency has reported.[146][147]
An explosion in Kabul reportedly leads to casualties. Afghan police state that the attack was aimed at a member of the National Assembly.[148][149]
perpetrator: Islamic State – Khorasan Province or Taliban (suspected)

details: Three suicide bombers killed by police in Moyu, Khotan prefecture in Xinjiang after ramming their vehicle into government complex. The attack killed an official and a security worker and 3 were injured.[150]
Islamic State executed a Palestinian girl after accusing her of supporting the Syrian regime.[151]
Islamic State executed three youths for collaborating with security forces.[152]
2016 Hilongos bombings: Two bombs injured 33 people who were attending an amateur boxing match in the town of Hilongos.[153]
A bomb exploded on a highway on the island of Mindanao, in Aleosan, wounding six people.[153]
The head of the Sikh community in Afghanistan's restive Kunduz city was shot dead by unidentified gunmen.[154]
perpetrator: Islamic State – Khorasan Province or Taliban (suspected)

details: One policeman has been killed and at least six others injured in an attack on a police checkpoint north of the capital Bogotá.[155]
A bomb kills one and 10 others were injured.[156]
Militants attack Army patrol, 2 jawans injured. The militants fired at the Army patrol in the morning at Gulshan mollah locality of Shahgund in the kashmir region.[157]
At least seven people including three (NISA) soldiers and four Al-Shabaab militants were killed after heavy fighting between the Somalian army and Al-Shabaab in Afgoye town, officials said.[158]
A suicide bombing injures at least 2 people in Rahim Yar Khan.[159]

A car bombing (car was damaged by shrapnel, but no one was injured) and a shooting (militants ambushed and shot at the car of a 51-year-old villager who was driving along a local road) have shaken south Thailand.[160]
Between 2 and 11 police were killed by insurgents in Farah.[161]
December 2016 Baghdad bombings: Bombings left at least 25 people dead and 50 others were injured in Baghdad.[162]

An improvised explosive device exploded outside a municipal gymnasium in the southern Philippines where a gathering for peace and unity was held on New Year's Eve, no one injured in blast outside municipal gymnasium.[163]
A police officer and a soldier were killed when a remote controlled bomb was detonated as their armored car passed by it.[164]
2017 Istanbul nightclub shooting: One gunman killed 39 individuals in the Reina Nightclub located in Istanbul during 2016–2017 New Year eve celebrations.[1][2]
At least six people were hurt in an explosion near a mosque in western Afghanistan.[3]
The Burundian environmental minister Emmanuel Niyonkuru was shot dead in the capital city of Bujumbura. A police spokesman said a woman was arrested in connection with the attack.[4]
Four Frontier Corps security personnel and two civilians were injured in a roadside bomb blast in Quetta.[5]
The Islamic State claimed responsibility for a shooting attack it said killed a Jordanian soldier.[6]
January 2017 Baghdad bombings: A series of car bombings in Sadr City and other parts of Baghdad killed at least 56 people and injured more than 120 others.[7]
January 2017 Mogadishu bombings: A suicide car bombing killed 7 people and injured 17 others at a checkpoint near Aden Adde International Airport in the Somali capital.[8]
Gunmen wearing suicide vests attacked two police stations in the central Iraqi city of Samarra, killing at least 7 officers.[9]
A Christian businessman was murdered by a Salafi Islamist for selling alcohol in his shop.[10]
Three Yemeni soldiers were killed and 10 others were injured in an ambush by al-Qaeda militants.[11]
A Taliban ambush in the northeastern Badakhshan province killed four Afghan police officers.[12]
Moroccan UN peacekeepers were ambushed by assailants while escorting fuel trucks; two peacekeepers were killed and two others were injured.[13][14][15]
Unknown gunmen killed two government officials in a drive-by shooting near Jinnah Town in Quetta.[16]
A car bomb attack injured four United Nations guards in Mogadishu in an explosion targeting the UN's compound.[17]

2017 Kidapawan jail siege: Around 100 gunmen attacked the North Cotabato District Jail in Kidapawan in the Southern Philippines. A total of 158 inmates escaped, fourteen of whom were quickly recaptured, while five others were killed.[18]

Three female suicide bombers were killed while attempting to detonate their vests at a market in the northeastern Nigerian city of Madagali. Local officials blamed Boko Haram for the attempted attack. A double suicide bombing in Madagali killed 57 people in December 2016.[19]
Two US service members were killed and two others were injured in a Taliban attack while performing a training mission with Afghan forces in Kunduz province.[20]
A policewoman was shot dead in the Nawa district of Helmand province.[21]
At least five people were injured in an armed attack on a caravan of vehicles carrying forest workers to the town of Curaquidico, in the southern region of the Bío Bío Province.[22]

A car bombing at a food market in the al-Obeidi area killed 9 people and left 15 others wounded. After nightfall a suicide car bomber killed 11 and injured 22 near a security checkpoint in Bab al-Muadam. Several smaller attacks around the city killed 7 people and injured 20 others.[23][24]
A car bomb exploded in the coastal city of Jableh, killing 16 people and injuring more than 30 others.[25]

2017 İzmir Courthouse Attack: A car bomb exploded outside a courthouse in Izmir, killing at least two people and triggering a deadly shootout. Two of the attackers were killed, while a third managed to escape.[26][27][28]
A man was stabbed for speaking Arabic.[30]

A bomb exploded outside a refugee centre. An immigration office staff member was seriously injured and lost both of his legs. Three neo-Nazis were arrested on suspicion of causing the blast. Another bomb had exploded outside a Gothenburg café in November 2016.[31][32]
A police checkpoint near Tikrit was attacked by suicide bombers and a car bomb. Four police officers and two attackers were killed, while 12 others were injured.[33]
Five members of the Hazara Shia community were injured when armed assailants opened fire on their vehicle.[34]
Two Egyptian Coptic Christians were murdered. They were murdered because of their faith, according to the brother of the dead woman.[35]
Islamic State militants beheaded an elderly man in Raqqa for allegedly practicing magic and sorcery.[36]

Gunmen shot dead at least 13 miners belonging to Afghanistan's Hazara minority after pulling their vehicle over in Baghlan Province. Local officials blamed the Taliban, but the group denied responsibility.[37]
shooting attack at Fort Lauderdale Airport [38]
An unknown person shoots and injures a 21-year-old in Belfast, Northern Ireland.[39]
Six Yemeni soldiers were killed and 20 others injured in a suicide attack in Abyan.[40]
Two CRPF jawans soldiers were injured in a powerful IED explosion near the office of Deputy Commissioner in western Imphal, in the state of Manipur.[41]
January 2017 Azaz bombing: At least 60 people were killed and 50 others wounded in a car bomb attack at a marketplace in the rebel-held northern town of Azaz.[43]
A large group of militants attacked a Nigerian Army base in Buni Yadi, but were repelled by government forces. At least five soldiers and 15 attackers were killed, with an unknown number injured.[44]
Two suicide bombers were killed by a police officer before they were able to self-detonate.
A blast occurred in Zabul Province. The attack left one dead and two others injured. All victims were policemen.[45]
At least five civilians were killed and many injured when a truck hit a landmine in Taiz's Al-Taziya district.[46]
Islamic State claimed responsibility for a pair of suicide car bombings in Baghdad. At least 20 were killed and more than 50 others were injured.[47]
2017 Jerusalem truck attack: At least four people were killed and 17 others were injured when a truck rammed into a group of Israeli soldiers.[48]
Several unidentified militants attacked a camp housing road construction workers in the Indian state of Jammu and Kashmir, killing three laborers before fleeing.[49]

Seven Egyptian police officers and one civilian were killed, while a total of 12 others were injured when insurgents detonated a truck bomb at a checkpoint near Arish in the Sinai Province. Government forces repelled the attack, killing five militants and injuring three others.[50]
A soldier was shot dead in an attack by ELN guerrillas.[51]
A police officer was wounded in central Athens as shots were fired outside the offices of the Pan-Hellenic Socialist Party.[52]
A suspected Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) militant was killed and a soldier injured  in an encounter in Hajin tehsil of Bandipora, Kashmir.[53]
A bombing left one dead in Zabul Province.[54]
A bomb killed one and another two were injured in the city of Jalalabad.[55]
Two female bombers killed themselves and three other people, when they went to private residences in the Kalari area, disguised as visitors.[56]

10 January 2017 Afghanistan bombings: A car bomb exploded in the center of the city of Kabul. At least 38 people were killed and at least 70 others were injured. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attacks, saying that vehicles carrying members of the National Directorate of Security were targeted.[57]

10 January 2017 Afghanistan bombings: 11 people, including five diplomats from the United Arab Emirates, were killed in a bomb attack.[58] On the 15 February 2017, the UAE ambassador succumbed to his wounds.[59]
10 January 2017 Afghanistan bombings: A suicide bombing on a house in Lashkargah claimed seven civilians lives and another six were injured.[60]
A grenade attack killed one person and injured 11 at a crowded hotel bar in the town of Gondar in the Amhara Region.[61]
A car bombing seriously wounded a senior security official and killed one of his guards. Four other guards were wounded in the attack.[62]
A Palestinian man attacked Israeli soldiers with a knife and was subsequently shot dead.[63]
Eight fishermen were killed in an attack by suspected Abu Sayyaf militants off south-western Mindanao.[64]
Suspected members of the EPP entered a house in San Pedro and attacked two Mennonite brothers in a possible failed kidnapping attempt.[65]
Militant group Al-Shabaab shot two men and a teenager in southern Somalia.[66][67]
A Nigerian soldier was killed by a bomb planted by Boko Haram militants.[68]
A car bomb detonated in the al-Bayaa district of Baghdad, killing one person and wounding five others.[69]
Five Malian soldiers were killed and two others injured when their patrol hit a landmine in Mali`s Segou region.[70]
A suicide bomber killed at least eight people in a high-security district of Damascus.[71][72]
A police officer was killed by Tehreek-e-Taliban[73]

The chairman of the board of Chilean state copper giant Codelco and twoother persons suffered non-life-threatening injuries on Friday from the detonation of a parcel bomb sent to his home in Santiago.[74] An "eco-terrorist" group called Individualists Tending Toward the Wild claimed responsibility.[75][76]
Two men in northeastern Syria were crucified after being accused of supporting the Kurdish YPG forces and the US-led coalition.[77]
Suicide bombers killed and injured many in a crowded market in the northeastern Nigerian town of Madagali.[78]
A man and woman were shot in Northern Ireland while attempting to protect their son from paramilitaries.[79][80]
perpetrator: Óglaigh na hÉireann (Real IRA splinter group)

details: Two soldiers were killed in Borno State in a roadside bombing.[81]
Three soldiers were killed by Boko Haram. Ten attackers were also killed.[82][83][84][85]
Islamic State militants burned a family of five people (a mother and four children).[86]
At least 17 people were killed by Boko Haram militants.[87][88]
At least seven civilians were killed in an explosion in the eastern Nangarhar province. Afghan officials also accused the Islamic State group of kidnapping 14 Muslim clerics.[89][90]
One person was killed in an arson attack in the southern region of La Araucania in the town of Cañete, an area of southern Chile where Mapuche indigenous people claim land.[91]
Nine people were killed by Fulani herdsmen.[92]
An American volunteer was killed by Islamic State.[93]
Two teenage suicide bombers exploded at Nigeria's University of Maiduguri, killing three people, including a professor.[94][95]
Four Turkish police officers were killed and two more were wounded when a roadside bomb hit a passing police bus.[96][97]
An explosive was detonated in the town of Sirnak, Turkey. The handmade explosive was attached under the vehicle of a council contractor repairing the city's water network.[98]

Eight Egyptian security officers were killed and three others were injured when their checkpoint around 70 km away from the Kharga Oasis was attacked by unidentified militants. At least two of the assailants were killed, while the others escaped.[99]
Bombing left one dead and two injured in Aris city.[100]
One person was killed and five others were wounded when two explosive devices exploded in Baghdad.[101]
Four soldiers were killed and three wounded in an Al-Qaeda attack on a checkpoint in Yemen.[102]
Two terrorist attacks left at least two police dead in Quetta.[103]
Two Ukrainian servicemen were wounded in the Donbass region. The casualties were caused by explosive devices in the district of Popasna.[104]

A shootout left 5 dead, among whom there were citizens of the USA, Canada, Colombia and Italy, in addition to 15 wounded. The shooting took place at the Blue Parrot nightclub, in the town of Playa del Carmen, a few kilometers from the resort of Cancun. The next day a ring of shootings were reported in the city of Cancun, increasing the number to ten killed (including three gunmen).[105][106]
Al-Shabaab allegedly executed a Ugandan soldier.[107]
Ten people were killed and more than 30 others injured in a suicide attack on security forces in Peshawar.[108]
A bomb kills one policeman and another four were injured. The explosion occurred in the city of Diyarbakır.[109]
The Counter-Terrorism Department (CTD) of Punjab police killed four suspected militants during an shooting in Sheikhupura on Tuesday night.[110]

2017 Gao bombing: Five suicide bombers exploded near a NATO army base. At least 65 people were killed while an unknown number of people were injured.
There were no reported casualties among the NATO troops.[111][112][113] Al-Mourabitoun claimed responsibility.[114]
At least two women and a girl were killed while four others injured by a pressure landmine, suspected to have been laid by Naxals.[115]
A car bomb blast hit the mostly Shi'ite neighborhood of Abu Dsheer.[116]
Islamic State militants put at least 12 people to death in execution-style killings.[117]
Terrorists shoot dead a civilian in the city of Arisr.[118]
An Iraqi elder and his grandson were killed in western Mosul in an explosion caused by a bomb dropped from an Islamic State guided drone.[119]
Turkey's military said the Islamic State group killed five Turkish soldiers and wounded nine others in a car bomb attack in Al-Bab, northern Syria.[120]
Two tribal elders were killed and six others sustained injuries when gunmen fired at them.[121]
An explosion in northern Afghanistan killed at least three people outside a game of buzkashi.[122]
A car bomb exploded on Friday near a mosque in Libya’s second city of Benghazi, killing one person and wounding 13 people including a former interior minister, medical and security sources said.[123]
2017 Parachinar bombing: A bomb that was placed in a vegetable crate exploded at a vegetable market in Parachinar, a city in Pakistan's Kurram Agency tribal area.[124][125][126]
A car bomb attack occurred in the Rakban refugee camp near the Jordanian border.[127][128]
Taliban attacked a police station located in Maiwand District of Kandahar Province, killing 43 people, including 16 police officers.[129]
Boko Haram killed two soldiers and wounded seven others in an attack on a military base in southeast Niger.[130]
Eight people were killed after a shell landed on a house in Rafah.[131]
Two suicide bombers detonated their explosives during a firefight with Saudi security forces in Jeddah.[132]
A car bomb exploded in Tripoli. The blast, which left at least two people dead, struck near the recently re-opened Italian embassy.[133]
Lebanese security forces shot and wounded a suicide bomber just before midnight as he attempted to enter a coffee shop on Hamra Street in Beirut.[134]
Two Assam Rifles jawans were killed when their vehicle escorting tourists was attacked near the Assam–Arunachal Pradesh border.[135]
A policeman was wounded in a filling station in Belfast. A possible terrorist act according to the local police.[136]
Insurgents killed at least three policemen in Kandahar Province.[137]
A terrorist attack left at least two people dead in Quetta.[138]
Maoists set at least 15 construction vehicles and machines on fire in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district.[139]
At least five Egyptian Army soldiers were killed by unknown gunmen in the Sinai Peninsula.[140]
A Kenya police reservist was killed when Al-Shabaab militants hurled explosives at a bank[141]
A bomb killed seven soldiers in Somalia along with a well-known Somali farmer.[142][143]
Boko Haram invaded a village, killed eight people and abducted an unspecified number of women and children.[144]
A peacekeeper in Mali was killed and two other peacekeepers were injured in mortar fire in Aguelhok. Al-Qaeda is suspected for the attack.[145]
A police officer was injured in a grenade attack. No group claimed the attack[146]
The Conspiracy of Fire Nuclei took responsibility for six arson attacks on various establishments including a bank and a post office.[147][148]
Two explosions caused by car bombs killed two civilians and wounded nine others in the Iraqi capital.[149]

2017 Dayah Hotel attack: At least 28 people, including four members of the security forces and 24 civilians, died in a coordinated attack against the Dayah Hotel in central Mogadishu. More than 40 others were injured, and four attackers were killed.[150][151][152]
A suicide bomb attack Borno state killed three and wounded two others.[153]
Boko Haram killed four people in multiple suicide bombing attacks.[154]
Al-Shabab attacked an African Union base in Somalia. Nine were killed.[155]
A bombing at a market in south Baghdad killed one person and wounded five others. Earlier in the day, an attack on a militia-held checkpoint killed one and injured three.[156]
An Islamic State drone dropped explosives on a house in central Mosul wounding three members of the same family[157]

Battle of Kulbiyow: Al-Shabaab militants attacked a remote AMISOM base in southern Somalia, claiming to have killed 66 Kenyan troops. An official of the Kenyan army said that only nine soldiers and 70 insurgents died in the attack.[158]
Terrorists shoot dead at least seven people and another three were injured.[159]
An American volunteer was killed by an Islamic State car bomb.[160]
Four people were killed by Al-Qaeda.[161]
A bomb kills one and another four were injured.[162]
A suicide bombing kills at least two police officers and another two were injured.[163]
Boko Haram attacked a convoy of motorists along a recently secured highway, killing at least seven people and injuring many others.[164]
A police officer in Bahrain was shot dead in an attack claimed by a Shi'ite militant group.[165]
A 72-year-old woman was killed by Islamists.[166]

At least four troops and two dozens militants were killed in Egypt’s Sinai Peninsula. Army forces killed 20 militants during a raid in northern and central Sinai. It was reported that seven militants were injured and 36 others detained.[167]
Two children were killed and three others were injured when a bomb went off in Al-Barka.[168]
At least three suspected militants are killed by Russian security forces during a firefight in Khasavyurt, Dagestan.[169]
Three soldiers were killed and nine civilians were injured in an Islamic State attack.[161]

Quebec City mosque shooting: At least six people were killed and 17 others injured when a gunman opened fire at a mosque. Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and Premier Philippe Couillard called the shooting a terrorist attack,[170][171] but the suspect was not charged with terrorism.[172]
An explosion killed one person and wounded four near a market in southern Baghdad.[173]
Two civilians were injured in a terrorist attack.[174]
Fifteen people were killed by Boko Haram militants.[175]
Two soldiers were killed while several others were injured in an ambush allegedly perpetrated by members of the New People's Army (NPA).[176]
A man was killed and three others injured in Cameroon following an attack by Boko Haram.[177]
An explosion left at least three children dead.[178]
Four civilians and three soldiers were injured in a bomb attack.[179]
At least two police officers and three suspected militants were killed during a gunfight in Shali, Chechnya.[180]
At least three people were reported killed and several others wounded when unknown gunmen opened fire on a car carrying passengers along the Juba-Nimule road.[181]
At least one soldier was shot dead and two others were wounded in an ambush.[182]
Islamic State attempted to assassinate the Deputy Security Chief of Aden. They detonated a bomb. Seven people were injured.[179]
A suicide bomber stormed the Dalori quarters mosque, during the morning prayers, killing one of their members.[183]
A Denver transit officer was killed by a mentally ill Army Veteran who had recently converted to Islam.[184]
Four alleged extremists belonging to an unspecified religious extremist group were killed in a shootout with the country's security forces.[185]
A roadside blast targeting a vehicle of the security forces left at-least eight people injured including three security personnel and five passengers of a public transport.[186]
A person was killed and two others were injured in three rocket attacks.[1]
The Islamic State executed five civilians in Hawija.[2]
Three civilians and three soldiers were executed by Islamic State militants.[3]
Seven soldiers were killed by an Al-Shabaab ambush.[4]
At least eleven police personnel were killed and five injured in a landmine blast triggered by suspected Maoists in Odisha’s Koraput district on Wednesday.[5]
Two soldiers were killed and six others were injured.[3]
Two Kenyan police officers and a 15-year-old boy were killed by an Al-Shabaab attack.[3][6]
An explosion killed one person and wounded three near a market in southern Baghdad. Another bombing earlier wounded two civilians.[7]
A cell of insurrectional anarchist group launched an explosive-incendiary attack on a Citibanamex bank.[8]
Al Shabaab militants attempted to assassinate Somali Senator Osman Mohamud Dufle by detonating an IED. No casualties were reported.[4]
Six people were killed by an Al-Qaeda bombing.[3]
A suspected Boko Haram attack along Cameroon's border with Nigeria killed a U.N. independent contractor and four others.[9]
Militants blew up a school in the city of Rafah in Egypt's northern Sinai Peninsula, according to a local security source.[10]

2017 Paris machete attack: A man armed with a knife was shot by a French soldier. The man was stopped while attempting to enter the Louvre and attacked a soldier with a machete. Another soldier shot the attacker, wounding him, and took him into custody.[11]
A Taliban insurgent killed at least eight police personnel.[12]
The New People's Army carried at least 20 attacks across the country and took at least 5 soldiers as "prisoners of war."[13]

The head of the Luhansk People's Republic militia, Colonel Oleg Anashchenko, was killed along with another person while riding on an official car in Luhansk city when the vehicle struck an improvised explosive device.[14]
Three soldiers were killed and several others injured by an Al-Shabaab bombing.[15]
Four soldiers were killed and eight others were injured in a terrorist attack.[16]
At least one person was injured as the Abu Sayyaf group is suspected of setting off a roadside bomb in Basilan province.[17]
An IED exploded in Manama, inflicting serious damage on several vehicles and buildings. No injuries were reported.[18]
Four Chadian soldiers were killed in a bomb attack.[19]
Four men were executed by Al-Shabaab.[20]
Two women and a child were killed in a rocket attack.[21]
Two attempted suicide attack were foiled. The two attackers were arrested.[22]
A security personnel and a civilian were killed in a Boko Haram attack.[23]
An Afghan district governor was killed in an explosion in Farah province.[24]

February 2017 Afghanistan's Supreme Court in Kabul attack: At least 22 people were killed and 41 wounded in a suicide blast at Afghanistan's Supreme Court in Kabul.[25] The Islamic State claimed responsibility.[26]
The Islamic State executed fifteen civilians in a village north of Mosul.[27]
A leader of a separatist battalion Mikhail Tolstykh was killed by the explosion of a bomb in his office.[28]
The Islamic State killed six local employees of the International Committee of the Red Cross.[26]
Islamic State militants attacked an hotel in Bosaso. Four people were killed.[29]
The Islamic State executed twenty civilians by burning them for alleged collaboration with Iraqi security forces. Seven Islamic State fighters were also executed for desertion.[30]
One person was killed and nineteen were wounded by Islamic State drone strikes.[31]
ISIS claimed responsibility for four rockets were fired from Egypt towards Eilat, causing damage to local buildings.[32][33]

A roadside bomb blast killed two Iraqi troops in western Iraq on Wednesday, according to a military officer. The explosion struck as a military vehicle was passing on a highway in western Ramadi, the provincial capital of Anbar province.[34]
Six people were lightly wounded after a shooting and stabbing attack at an open market in the central Israeli town of Petah Tikva.[35]
Nine persons were killed in two rocket attacks.[36]
Four militiamen were killed and several others were injured in two bombs attacks.[37]
At least ten people were killed and 33 others wounded in a car bomb explosion in the Iraqi capital of Baghdad.[38]
A man blew himself up inside a restaurant in Mosul, killing at least four people and wounding 15. Another person was killed in another suicide bombing attack.[39]
The Islamic State in Egypt executed five men it accused of working for the army.[40]
7 soldiers were killed and 19 injured in Boko Haram ambush in Borno State.[41]
Boko Haram invaded a village in Borno State and set ablaze dozens of residential houses and a man suspected to were trapped in the attack.[42]
Four civilians and three soldiers were killed and dozens more wounded in a suicide bombing in Lashkar Gah.[43]
Seven civilians and five soldiers were killed and dozens more wounded in a suicide bombing outside a bank in Helmand province.[44]
Militants killed a 55-year old civilian in Al-Arish as he attempted to stop the kidnapping of his son, who was taken by the militants following the shooting.[45]
Islamic State militants burned to death 15 civilians, including children, for attempted to escape territory they control.[46]
An assistant cameraman of Samaa TV was killed when a DSNG van of the channel came under attack in Karachi. Tehreek-i-Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.[47]
A roadside bomb killed three Pakistani paramilitary soldiers and three civilians in Waziristan.[48]
2017 Lahore suicide bombing: A powerful bomb blast ripped through a protest in the Pakistani city of Lahore, killing at least 14 people and wounding 90. Jamaat-ul-Ahrar claimed responsibility.[49]
Two policemen were killed and nine others received injuries in a blast in Quetta.[50][51]
At least two Ukrainian military men were killed and three civilians were injured in a clash between Kiev troops and members of the radical group Pravy Sektor.[52]
The Islamic State shelled a school north of Mosul killing three students and a teacher, and wounding 24 others.[53]
Boko Haram invaded Mifa community in Chibok Local Government Area of Borno State, killing an Islamic scholar and breaking the hands of a boy.[54]

Assassination of Kim Jong-nam: The assassination of Kim Jong-nam occurred on 13 February 2017 when two women attacked him with VX nerve agent, a lethal chemical weapon, at Kuala Lumpur International Airport in Malaysia.[55]
Three assailants killed five people and injured 10 others before they were shot dead by police on Tuesday in Pishan county. No motive was given, but the government blamed separatists.[56]
Wilayah al-Bayda detonated a suicide vehicle-borne improvised explosive device targeting al Houthi-Saleh forces in Rada’a that killed at least two al Houthi-Saleh troops and one innocent child.[57]
Eight passengers were wounded when suspected Abu Sayyaf gunmen shot at a bus on the outskirts of Zamboanga.[58]

A suicide bomber killed three policemen and two civilians near an administrative building in the Federally Administered Tribal Areas. An accomplice was shot and killed as he tried to enter the building. A second suicice bomber failed to cause any casualties when his suicide vest detonated prematurely.[59]
2017 Hayatabad suicide bombing: A suicide bomber targeted a vehicle carrying local judges and government officials killing the driver and a civilian and wounding five passengers.[60][61]
Several bombings killed eighteen people and wounded at least 30 including a car bomb near a market that killed five and wounded 20.[62]
Three people were killed and four were wounded by an Islamic State drone strike in eastern Mosul.[63]
A policemen was killed in a shooting attack carried out by militants.[64]
The Islamic State executed 13 civilians by drowning them in metal cages in Mosul.[65]
The Islamic State executed 8 civilians in Hawija.[65]
At least 59 people were killed and more than 60 others were wounded in a car bomb explosion at a car dealership.[66][67][68]
2017 Sehwan suicide bombing: A suicide bombing at a popular shrine in southern Pakistan killed at least 91 people and wounded over 300. The Islamic State claimed responsibility.[69][70]
A Coptic Christian teacher was gunned down by suspected Islamic militants in northern Sinai.[71]

A group of militants launched simultaneous attacks against several Afghan Army outposts in the country's eastern Nangarhar Province. At least 17 soldiers and 21 attackers were killed after several hours of heavy fighting. The Islamic State group later claimed responsibility.[72]
Two soldiers and three New People’s Army rebels were killed while 15 other troops were wounded in a land mine attack and clashes, officials said yesterday.[73]
Two Frontier Corps personnel were injured when militants attacked a post along the Pak-Afghan border in Khyber Agency.[74]
Two civilians were killed by a suicide bombing. Other 8 attackers, were killed by the police.[75]
Two children were killed and their parents were injured in an al-Shabaab mortar attack close to Somalia’s presidential palace during a handover ceremony for the country’s new leader.[76]
A roadside bombing killed five soldiers and left two others injured.[77]
Islamic State militants attacked a Popular Mobilization Forces battalion headquarters southeast of Tikrit, killing eight militia members and injuring an unknown number.[66]
A child and a man were killed and 17 others were injured in a large car bomb blast in Viransehir, in Turkey's Şanlıurfa Province.[78]

Two motorized police were shot to death by suspected guerrillas who also triggered a fragmentation grenade, leaving the patrol motorcycle totally incinerated. In the reaction of the police, one of the attackers who was captured was wounded.[79]
A campaigner for the newly elected president of Somalia and an ex-intelligence deputy chief were killed in two attacks. Another was injured.[80]
Two persons were killed by an Islamic State suicide bomber.[81]
Gunmen in southern Philippine waters killed one crewman of a Vietnamese vessel and abducted seven.[82]
At least 39 people were killed and more than 50 others were injured when a car packed with explosives blew up at a market near a busy intersection in the Somali capital of Mogadishu.[83]

2017 Bogota Bombing An explosion happened near a bullring, where animal rights activists were preparing to hold a march. It is not yet clear if the blast was linked to the march, but the Bogotá mayor Enrique Penalosa called the perpetrators "terrorists."[84][85]

An officer of the State Emergency Service died in a Dnipro hospital of wounds he had suffered in Avdiivka on 2 February. Two Ukrainian servicemen were wounded in the Donbass region and seven servicemen were injured when a truck they were riding in exploded on an unidendified explosive device at Lebedynske.[86]

Heavily armed Fulani herdsmen, on Sunday and Monday, killed at least 20 people in Southern Kaduna during attacks on four different locations. The herdsmen also engaged in fierce gun battles with soldiers and mobile policemen, who moved in to quell the attacks.[87]
Kenyan Defense Forces military convoy was targeted in a roadside bomb blast near the southern port town of Kismayo.[88]
Islamic State drones and rocket shelling killed 11 civilians in areas recaptured by security forces in eastern Mosul.[89]
An IED bombing at a market killed one person and wounded four.[90]
In the Peruvian city of Iquitos, opponents of the provincial government on duty detonated a bomb in 28 de Julio Square [91]

A Sinn Féin election agent's car was set on fire during a petrol bomb attack in Bangor, County Down. Sinn Féin's leader in Northern Ireland Michelle O'Neill stated that the attacks were politically motivated to affect the upcoming election.[92]
A car bombing in the southwestern Baghdad neighborhood of Amiriya killed 7 civilians and injured at least 30 others.[93]
A police officer was executed by Islamic State militants.[94]
2017 Charsadda suicide bombing: At least seven people, including a lawyer were killed and 21 others injured as a sessions court in Charsadda was hit by multiple suicide bombers.[95]
Two Christians were killed by Islamic State militants. The first was shot dead and the second was abducted and later burned alive.[96]
The United Nations peacekeeping mission in the Central African Republic reported that its troops on patrol were ambushed outside of Ippy in Ouaka prefecture.[97]
perpetrator: Popular Front for the Rebirth of Central African Republic

details: A bomb exploded under a car outside of a police officer's home in Derry. The bomb went off as Army technical officers were trying to defuse the device. No one was killed or injured in the incident, which is being blamed on dissident republicans.[98]
Benghazi’s security chief Saleh Hweidi suffered minor injuries when a car bomb exploded as his convoy drove past it in Benghazi.[99]
A group of militants ambushed an army patrol outside Tiloa, near the border with Mali, killing 15 soldiers and injuring 19 more.[100]

2017 Olathe, Kansas shooting: A Kansas man shot three people after yelling "get out of my Country." The gunman said he believed the men he shot were Middle Eastern, but the victims were Indian engineers.An Indian man was killed and another was injured. Ian Grillot, an American who tried to save them, was also shot.[101]
Three soldiers were killed and five others, including a Lieutenant Colonel and a Major, were injured when militants ambushed an Army convoy in Shopian.[102]

At least 53 people were killed in a car bombing, followed by a secondary blast which killed 8 others. The Islamic State group claimed responsibility for the attack, which came one day after they were pushed out of the nearby city of Al-Bab.[103]
A suicide bomber killed at least eight soldiers in an attack on a military camp in Yemen's southern city of Zinjibar at dawn on Friday.[104]

Suspected Islamic State militants gunned down a Coptic Christian inside his home in northern Sinai. The militants stormed his home, and shot him to death in front of his wife and children in the town of el-Arish.[105]
Islamic State militants attacked an Iraqi border crossing outside of Rutba with a suicide car bomb and gunmen. 15 soldiers were killed including 2 officers. No reports on injuries.[106]
A suicide car bomb killed at least two soldiers and wounded three others in the southern Helmand province.[107]
