A roadside bomb struck a military convoy belonging to Ethiopian troops in the Gedo region. Around 40 soldiers were killed and injured in the bomb attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.[212][213]

A child was killed and about 30 people were injured when militants on a motorcycle hurled grenades towards a security center in the town of Shahr in the Hadhramaut Governorate, Al-Qaeda claimed responsibility for the attack.[214][215][216]

Around 26 people were killed and at least 40 others were injured in car bomb attacks near the president's residence and a radio station, in Mogadishu. The attacks were done by Al-Shabaab.[217][218][219][220]
Three soldiers were killed and four others were injured when a bomb struck their vehicle in a highway in the Kompienga Province.[221]
Six security personnel were injured when militants hurled a grenade towards the officers while they were doing a search operation.[222]
A child was killed when Tahrir-al-Sham fired on a vehicle carrying IDPs in the suburbs of Idlib.[223]
Gunmen believed to be of the Islamic State attacked a checkpoint in Khanaqin, killing a policeman and placing a bomb nearby.[224]
A Cameroonian soldier was shot dead in a separatist militant ambush in the Mbengwi town, Momo Division.[225]

location: Beni, Democratic Republic of the Congo
details: Gunmen of the Allied Democratic Forces, attacked a village in the city of Beni, killing 5 people and injuring 3 others. In addition to that, 3 people were also left missing and several goats were stolen by the gunmen.[226][227]
The Taliban ambushed police officers in the Takhar Province, killing 3 policemen including a senior officer and also injuring 4 others.[228][229]

Two policemen were killed and two others were wounded when multiple gunmen hurled a grenade towards a police a station in the town of Bosaso. No group has claimed responsibility but the Islamic State in Somalia are suspected to be behind the attack.[230]

Three civilians were killed and two were wounded, when the vehicle they were traveling on struck a roadside bomb in the Helmand Province. According to police, the bomb had been placed by the Taliban.[231]
Seven civilians were killed in the Dih Yak District, when their minibus had struck a roadside bomb. Officials blamed the bombing on the Taliban.[232][233]
Militants in the Noun Department, killed one person and injured several others. Several people were also kidnapped. Over 60 houses and vehicles were also burnt down by the militants.[234]
One person was killed and many houses were burnt down when Boko Haram attacked a village in Chibok.[235][236]

A suicide bomb and a gun attack on a Kabul government compound killed 43 people and injuring 25 others, 4 attackers are said to have been killed. No group has claimed responsibility yet for the attack.[237][238][239][240]
A district police chief and three of his bodyguards were killed after a mortar fired by the Taliban, struck a military compound.[241]

A police officer was killed and 5 others were wounded in a bomb attack on a police vehicle in the province of Narathiwat, gunmen opened fire on the vehicle afterwards, insurgents are presumed to be behind the attack.[242][243]

Two members of the Afghan National Civil Order Police (ANCOP) were killed by two of their colleagues in a inner attack in Konjak village of Faizabad District. The two attackers escaped with a Humvee they were traveling in and weapons. A fifth officer escaped.[244]
A Boko Haram ambush close to the town of Damaturu, killed 14 security personnel and injured at least a soldier.[245][246]

An improvised device detonate in front of the Sacred Heart of Jesus Cathedral in the town of Ecatepec, State of México. The attack no left injuries, but caused an mobilization of the authorities in the area. A cell belonging to ITS claimed responsibility for the attack.[247][248]

Two people were killed and 13 others were wounded when a bomb exploded in Baidoa, as the youth were doing celebrations, no group claimed responsibility but Al-Shabaab were suspected after similar attacks in this area in the past.[249]

The Taliban attacked Gorziwan District, killing three police officers. The district police chief, Abdul Samad Gorziwani, suffered severe injuries during the fighting and died of his wounds the next day.[250]

An improvised explosive device were detonate safely for the Batalhão de Operações Policiais Especiais in fornt of the Santuário Menino Jesus in Brasilia. The police detained a suspect days later.[251][252][253]
perpetrator: [[:es:Individualistas Tendiendo a lo Salvaje|Sociedad Silvestre Salvaje]

details: Around 20 civilians were kidnapped by Islamic State militants in Kirkuk, one of the kidnapped civilians managed to escape later while the fate of the rest of the kidnapped civilians remains unknown.[254][255]
A suicide bomber detonated in the city of Kandahar, killing three people and injuring two others, no group has claimed responsibility yet for the attack.[256][257]
A car bomb blast killed two people and injured 11 others in Tal Afar, the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the blast.[258][259][260]

Four suicide bombers attacked and stormed Libya's foreign ministry in the capital of Tripoli. Three people and four perpetrators were killed, while ten others were left injured. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.[261][262][263]
Two Afghan soldiers were killed and twelve Taliban militants were killed in attacks on checkpoints in the Faryab Province, two Afghan soldiers were also wounded and three Taliban militants.[264]
Four Kenyan soldiers were injured when an explosive device went off in a military van. Al-Shabaab militants are presumed to be behind the attack.[265][266]

A bomb attack and a subsequent gunfight were reported in a road of Bacho district, Narathiwat Province. At least 20-25 kg of explosives and a large quantity of gunmen armed with M16s were used in the attack, the investigations still ongoing.[267][268]
A local police outpost was attacked and captured by the Taliban in Chimtal District. Three local police were killed and four were wounded.[269]
At least seven Syrian soldiers were killed and ten others were wounded in an attack by the "Rouse the Believers" group in the Jabal al-Akrad mountains in Syria.[270][271]
A Taliban Red Unit attacked an Afghan army base in Almar District, killing six soldiers and wounding four others.[272]
Eleven soldiers were wounded during an encounter with NPA rebels in Monkayo, the encounter occurred as the officers were investigating IEDs placed by the rebels.[273]

A series of sabotages were reported in the state of Zulia, the venezuelan president Nicolás Maduro, blamed "trained groups " in Colombia for constant blackouts in the border state of Zulia. [274][275]
Two police officers were killed in a Taliban attack in Greshk District.[276]
A roadside mine exploded in Khan Abad District, killing one police officer and wounding three others.[277]

A police officer and a church caretaker was injured after a bomb was detonated outside a Orthodox church of Saint Dionysius the Areopagite in the upscale Kolonaki area, Athens. An eco-terrorist groupl claimed the incident more two weeks later.[278][279]
Armed Chadian militants attacked a military camp of Libyan soldiers near Traghan, killing 7 and injuring 43 others.[280][281]
Boko Haram attacked a military base in the town of Baga, killing 10 people and according to some reports, Boko Haram may have taken over the town.[282][283]

A security patrol was struck by roadside bombs and also an ambush, killing 10 officers and wounding 3 others in the province of Sourou, the Al-Qaeda linked group Jama'at Nasr al-Islam wal Muslimin claimed responsibility for the attack.[284][285][286]
A van crashed into a group of police officers during an antiterrorist control in La Rambla, central Barcelona. Police detained the French driver and suspects a terrorist motive.[287]

Four members of the Syrian Democratic Forces were killed, when an explosive device targeted a four-wheel drive near a court building in the center of Manbij, the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.[288][289]
Two people were killed and two others were injured in a bomb explosion in the town of Beledweyne, Al-Shabaab is suspected to be behind the attack.[290]

Three Vietnamese tourists and an Egyptian guide were killed while twelve other people were injured near the pyramids of Giza, when the tour bus carrying them struck a roadside bomb. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack as of yet. Islamist extremists have targeted tourists in the past.[291][292][293]

Two police officers were killed and 5 others were wounded in twin bombings in southern Mosul, three police officers who were recently kidnapped by militants were also found dead in the area nearby.[294]
Four people on motorcycles were injured when a bomb exploded in Narathiwat's Si Sakhon District, insurgents are suspected for the attack.[295]
A grenade was thrown against a bus stand, causing a low intensity blast in the India's Jammu. No casualties were reported.[296]
ISIL gunmen attacked a federal police outpost near Khanaqin, killing two officers and clashes broke out.[297]
Cells of the ISIL organization attacked positions of the Self-Defense Forces in the Al-Omar oilfield, killing 9 people and injuring up to 5 others.[298]
Six Afghan civilians including four women and two children were killed as a result of an IED blast in the Shirin Tagab District, the attack was blamed on the Taliban.[299][300]

Two members of the bomb disposal squad were killed, when they were struck by a bomb in the Mohmand District, another person also suffered injuries, the organization Hizbul Ahrar claimed responsibility.[301][302]

location: Si Sakhon District and Chanae District, Thailand
details: Two Homemade attacks were reported in and , four in Chanae district,explosives were "detonated by radio", adding that no one was injured, the authorities said.[303]
The Co-chair of the Legislative Council of Deir-ez-Zor city was gunned down by assailants in the Deir- ez-Zor countryside, ISIL claimed responsibility for the assault.[304][305]
A woman was killed and three soldiers were wounded in shootings and ambush attacks by suspected insurgents in the province of Pattani.[306]
Eight Somali soldiers were killed in an Al-Shabaab attack in the Bay Region of Somalia, after the terrorists attacked the military base.[307]
A colombian soldier was killed after a gunfight in the rural zone of San Calixto, Norte de Santander Department.[308]

Militants burned four civilian buses and shot dead a civilian in Aurangabad, Maharastra. In other incident naxals burnt a truck near a mine in  Gadchiroli district, Maharastra, but there no casualty, police said[309][310]
Four civilians were killed and three others were wounded in a roadside bomb explosion in the province of Ghazni.[311]
A national guard vehicle was ambushed by presumed Katiba Macina assailants in the Koulikoro Area, two soldiers were killed and two others were wounded.[312][313]

Unknown gunmen believed to be ISIL cells attacked with machine guns the town of Al-Tayanna in the Deir-ez-Zor suburbs, killing at least 3 members of the Syrian Democratic forces and also killing a civilian.[314]

A district police chief was killed in Taluqan, when a bomb exploded in a vehicle, three other civilians were wounded in the incident, no group has claimed responsibility but groups like the Taliban has been trying to expand influence in the area.[315][316]
Two people were killed and at least 28 others suffered injuries, when a bomb went off near a mall in the city of Cotabato, the attack was blamed on a pro-ISIL group.[317][318][319]

Police came under fire from militants after the police were sent to investigate the corpse of a person who was beheaded by militants of East Indonesia, the gunfight in the Parigi Moutong Regency resulted in two injuries of the policemen.[320][321]

At least one soldier were injuried when militants attacked the Counter-terrorist base of Kepashiato, in Echarate district, La Convención Province in Cusco. The soldier injured its out of danger.[322][323]
An attack launched by Islamic State militants, killed 2 security forces and injured 2 others in the province of Diyala.[324]
A Somali military official was shot and killed by Al-Shabaab gunmen in the Capital of Somalia, Mogadishu.[325]

Three people including one police officer were stabbed in an attack at Victoria Station in Manchester on new years eve. A man was arrested and a witness claims he heard the attacker shout 'Allahu Akbar'. The perpetrator was detained by the police, officers from the counter terrorism are leading the investigation.[326]
Two UN staff and a contractor were injured when mortars fired by Al-Shabaab landed in a UN compound in Mogadishu. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.[1]
The Taliban attacked security posts in the province of Ghazni, killing 3 policemen and wounding 5 others in the attack.[2]

location: Nangarhar Province and Sar-e Pol Province, Afghanistan
details: The Taliban attacked security checkpoints in the Sar-e Pol Province causing clashes in which 21 security forces died and 23 were wounded. A shooting also started between Islamic State militants and Afghan officers in the Nangarhar Province resulting in the deaths of 27 terrorists.[3][4][5]
37 civilians were killed in an attack perpetrated by Dozo extremists in the Mopti region. Many houses were burnt and livestock were taken away, while several others were also injured.[6][7]
More than 20 Syrian soldiers were killed when ISIL launched an attack towards an army camp in the village of Al-Sayyal. The militants fled to the desert after the attack.[8]

location: Takhar Province and Balkh Province, Afghanistan
details: 8 policemen were killed and 5 others were wounded in simultaneous Taliban attacks in the Afghan provinces of Takhar and Balkh. 3 Taliban militants were also killed and 3 were wounded in the attacks.[9]
An SPO officer was gunned down by presumed militants in a village in the Pulwama District. This attack came after 4 Jaish-e-Mohammed militants were killed in the same village two days prior.[10][11]

Yirgou Massacre: 49 people were killed in both jihadist attacks and ethnic clashes caused by jihadists. The events started when a jihadist group killed 6 people. Afterward, people from the ethnic group of the Mossi retaliated against the Fulani community, committing many acts of violence in which 43 were killed. In total 49 people were killed and many were injured in both of the attacks. A total of 6,103 people are displaced. The events occurred in the area of Barsaloglo.[12][13][14][15][16][17]

Security guards shot dead four terrorist including a suicide bomber in the Loralai area in Pakistan. Four security guards were also killed in the attack and two guards were also injured in an attack claimed by the Pakistani Taliban.[18][19]

Two suicide blasts killed 3 Libyan soldiers and injured another one in the town of Ghadwa, near Sabha. The first blast was near a police station and killed 3 and injured 1, while the other suicide blast occurred after the suicide bomber was arrested in the police station. No one was injured or killed in the second suicide blast. ISIL is suspected of being behind the attack.[20][21]
A helicopter of the Nigerian army crashed during combat with Boko Haram. Two pilots and three officers died.[22]
A powerful bomb was detonated by the Taliban, near a military base in Kandahar's Maywand District, killing 5 soldiers and injuring 6 others.[23][24]

An attacker was killed and another one was wounded when infiltrators fired a rocket towards a foreign forces vehicle. An Italian adviser escaped unscathed and other foreign forces escaped unscathed. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack yet, but Taliban militants routinely urge serving Afghan security forces to attack NATO personnel in Afghanistan, mostly as advisers.[25][26][27]
19 civilians were killed and 8 others were wounded when suspected members of the National Salvation Front (NAS) launched an attack on the outskirts of Juba on Wednesday.[28][29][30]

Militants fired rocket-propelled-grenades toward the Municipal Council Headquarters in the city of Sirte. No one was killed or injured in the attack, although some damage was done to the building.[31]

An Islamic State ambush attack on an SDF convoy, killed 20 members of the Syrian Democratic Forces and injured dozens of others near the town of Al-Suwar in the Northern Deir ez-Zor province. The attack began with a roadside bomb being detonated on the convoy, then afterwards the militants launched the attack.[32][33]

In front of an office of the right-wing populist AfD in Döbeln, Saxony, a bomb exploded. Three German nationals were arrested and the terrorism department of the Police of Saxony is investigating a possible left-wing extremist motive.[34][35]
The Taliban attacked a security checkpoint in the province of Baghlan with guns, and rocket-propelled grenades, killing 8 policemen and injuring 2 others.[36]

Boko Haram ambushed an NGO convoy in the town of Banki in the Borno State, killing 2 soldiers and injuring 7 civilians. Militants opened fire indiscriminately on the convoy and seized a truck belonging to Intersos, an NGO representing the World Food Programme in the town.[37][38]
Islamic State militants raided a house in Western Mosul, and killed three brothers in the house.[39]
Three policemen were injured when the local gendarmerie brigade came under attack from armed separatist fighters in Mbelenka, a locality in the Lebialem Division.[40]

3 soldiers were injured in a gunfight with Hizbul-Mujahideen in Tral. Three terrorists belonging to the group were also killed in the gunfight. A soldier later succumbed to his injuries bringing the death toll to 1.[41][42][43]
A Somali senior police officer was gunned down by Al-Shabaab gunmen in the Capital city of Somalia, Mogadishu.[44]
A soldier was killed and two others were injured when PKK militants opened fire on a security patrol in Aralik. The soldiers then retaliated, killing a militant and injuring two others.[45]
Four police posts came under attack from the Arakan Army, killing 13 policemen and injuring 9 others in the area of the Buthidaung in the Rakhine State.[46][47][48]
ISIL militants killed 3 members of the SDF in a shooting attack in a town in the countryside of Deir-ez-Zor. Another member of the SDF was also left wounded in the attack.[49]

5 people were left injured when an explosive device detonated at a bus stop in Santiago, Chile. An eco-terrorist group named Individualists Tending the Wild (Individualistas Tendientes a lo Salvaje) claimed responsibility for the bombing.[50][51]
A Sikh man was shot dead by several militants in Jammu and Kashmir's Tral township.[52][53]

Clashes between the Yemeni government's Elite Forces in Shabwa province and tribal gunmen protecting suspected Al Qaeda members resulted in the death of six soldiers and nine gunmen. Another 13 soldiers and dozens of the gunmen were injured in 12 hours of fighting. The clashes started when an Elite Forces battalion tried to storm the village in search of Al Qaeda suspects but were blocked by the tribal fighters.[54]
Two cops were killed and three others were wounded in a Taliban attack on Samangan's Dara-I-Suf District. A checkpost was also seized by the militants.[55]
ELN guerrillas attacked the Caño Limón–Coveñas pipeline in the village of Campo Giles, in the municipality of Tibú, in Norte de Santander.[56]
A roadside bomb explosion in Western Anbar left 2 civilians seriously injured. Police cordoned the area to search for more explosives.[57]

Journalist Javid Noori was killed by Taliban fighters. He was travelling on a bus with around 30 other passengers when it was stopped and searched at a Taliban roadblock. The Taliban shot him after finishing their search. "He was killed after being checked and then moved to one side,” a witness said. The Taliban later issued a formal statement announcing “the execution of an enemy officer during a control."[58]
An attack by the Taliban on the Spin Boldak area of Kandahar, Afghanistan, killed 15 officials and left 7 others injured.[59]
Six people were left wounded when a car bomb exploded near a market in Pakistan's Peshawar.  No group has claimed responsibility yet for the bombing.[60][61]

At least one member of the Syrian Democratic Forces was killed and another one was wounded after a missile attack launched by the Islamic State in the area of Al-Shaafah. At least two British soldiers were also wounded in the attack.[62][63]

An explosives expert was killed and two other policemen were injured while trying to defuse a bomb placed outside a church in the suburbs of Cairo. The incident occurred two days before Coptic Christmas. No group has claimed responsibility yet for the bombing.[64][65]

location: Mudiyah District and Shabwah Governorate, Yemen
details: Two security members were killed when Al-Qaeda members tried to seize a security checkpoint in the Mudiyah District. The attackers opened heavy fire and lobbed grenades but were met with resistance. Later, Yemeni government forces, backed by the United Arab Emirates, launched a security operation against Al-Qaeda in the Shabwah Province. The operation sparked clashes in which 5 soldiers were killed and 7 Al-Qaeda militants were killed.[66]
A woman and a child were killed and 16 others were injured in shelling by Houthi rebels in the town of Taiz in Yemen.[67]
Maoists shot and killed a man suspecting of being a police informant. The Maoists also burnt five vehicles, including three tractors and a road roller in Phulbani area.[68][69]

Gunmen killed a civilian in Somalia’s capital Mogadishu on Saturday night, the latest in a series of attacks in the city by Al-Shabaab militant group. Eyewitnesses confirmed to Radio Shabelle via phone that two men armed with pistols have shot and killed a young man and fled the crime scene before police arrived.[70]
Seven security personnel were left wounded when a bike bomb exploded in the Pishin District. Hizbul-Ahrar claimed responsibility for the attack.[71][72]
An Iraqi was killed and eight others were injured in two bomb blasts in the oil rich province of Kirkuk. The perpetrators are believed to be of the Islamic State.[73]
Two Afghan policemen on a vehicle were ambushed and killed by Taliban militants in the province of Baghlan.[74]
5 civilians were abducted from their homes by Islamic State militants, in an area close the city of Tikrit. A search operation by security forces was launched afterwards.[75]

Seven civilians were killed after their vehicle was stopped by insurgents in the Nangade District. The armed men opened fire on the van and made the occupants leave the van and then they beheaded the driver and killed six other people.[76][77][78]
A man was killed and beheaded by suspected jihadists in Naliwa near Palma, Mozambique.[78]

Taliban insurgents stormed security posts in west Afghanistan, killing 21 police and pro-government militia members. The Taliban attacked the checkpoints in two different parts of Badghis province, which is on the border with Turkmenistan. Abdul Aziz Bek, head of the Badghis provincial council, said 14 policemen and seven members of pro-government militias were killed, while nine were injured. A second government official, Jamshid Shahabi, a spokesman for the Badghis provincial governor, said more than 15 Taliban militants were killed and 10 wounded in the clashes.[79]

At least six civilians were killed and eight wounded in a bomb blast in a market in the eastern province of Paktika. The Taliban left the bomb in a village square, according to provincial official Mohammad Rasoul Adel.[80][79]
Three civilians including an Islamic Cleric were killed in Boko Haram attacks on communities located in the Borno State, hundreds of other villagers fled as a result of the attacks.[81]

An Islamic State suicide bomber killed 5 people, including 4 civilians and a member of the SDF. Eight other people were also wounded. The attack occurred at a center of the Kurdish People's Protection Units (YPG) in Raqqa. The attacker first opened fire on them with a machine gun and then self detonated.[82][83][84]

location: Beni, Democratic Republic of the Congo
details: 10 civilians were killed and another one was injured, when suspected ADF rebels attacked by gunfire and machetes a village in Beni, the gunmen also looted animals.[85][86]
Ismail Hamed threw rocks and brandished a knife before being shot by an Arizona sheriff wounding Hamed, the man currently faces a terrorism charge.[87]
Two soldiers were killed and several others were injured in two bomb attacks targeting military vehicles in towns close to Mogadishu, Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attacks.[88]

Two civilians were killed and 23 other people were wounded when an explosive rigged motorbike exploded in the city of Khost, the Taliban is suspected to be behind the attack, but they did not comment on the attack.[89][90]
A roadside bomb struck and detonated a civilian vehicle in Mahfad, killing 2 civilians and injuring 12 others. Local sources put the blame on the Yemeni al-Qaeda branch.[91]
A young boy was killed and three other people were injured as a result of a bike bomb explosion in Raqqa. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the bombing.[92][93]
Three people were killed and five were injured by the explosion of an anti-tank landmine in the province of Hama. The landmine had been left by Islamic State militants.[94][95]

A suicide car bomb blast in Tikrit, killed 3 people and injured 10 others including soldiers, police officers and civilians. The Islamic State group is believed to have been behind the attack.[96][97]

Officials said insurgents hanged a local resident and stole the vehicle, which was later packed with explosives. The vehicle was parked near an ad hoc security base. Two soldiers were injured. A deputy minister blamed the attack on Barisan Revolusi Nasional.[98][99]
A bomb exploded near a school in the Pattani Province. Two students were injured in the blast.[100]
Six security members were killed in a Taliban attack in Balkh's Charbolak District, the Taliban also set on fire three armored vehicles and took seven policemen hostage.[101]

location: Beni, Democratic Republic of the Congo
details: 7 civilians and 3 soldiers were killed when ADF rebels attacked an army position in a village close to Beni. 2 other soldiers were left wounded in the attack.[102][103]
A bomb blast in a village at Daquq killed a civilian and wounded 2 others. The Islamic State group is believed to be behind the attack.[104]
A natural gas pipeline was bombed by militants in the Sadiqabad area. The Baloch Republican Army claimed responsibility for the bombing.[105][106]

location: Antioquia Department and El Bordo, Cauca, Colombia
details: A Cano Limon pipeline was bombed twice in Antioquia province, with ELN rebels suspected. An attempted ELN attack on the office of mayor of El Bordo was prevented.[107][108]
Attacks by members of the UPC militia, killed two police officers and injured another in the town of Bambari. The attacks occurred ahead of a scheduled visit by the country's president.[109]

An Algerian member of the Turkish-backed National Front for Liberation beheaded a Syrian man that was accused of working with the Syrian government. The Algerian member of the NFL said the Syrian man smuggled members of the Syrian government out of the rebel-held areas to the town of Rahjan in northeastern Hama. The beheading happened in an undisclosed area in northern Syria.[110]

A 15-year-old teenage girl was stabbed by a suspected terrorist while she was standing at a bus stop in Jerusalem’s Armon Hanatziv neighborhood. Security forces are investigating the stabbing attack. A manhunt for the terrorist began right after.[111]

A magnetic explosive device (MIED), exploded near an oil tanker in Jalalabad. The bombing caused a huge explosion and a blaze, in which three vehicles were destroyed. The Islamic State group took responsibility for the bombing.[112][113][114]
Gunmen set on fire some P30 million worth of two payloaders, a road roller, a transit mixer, a dump truck belonging to a construction firm in Kalamansig town.[115][116]

At least 25 Taliban fighters, including a senior commander of the group, Mawlawi Badr, were killed in clashes with security forces in Chahar Bolak district in Balkh province, provincial police said. Four security force members were also killed and four others were wounded. Clashes are still ongoing.[117]
Militants of the ISIL organization attacked a factory and set it on fire in the outskirts of Khanaqin town.[118]

Four civil defense volunteers were shot dead by suspected militants in a school in Pattani's Yarang District. Police suspect the attack could have been done by Barisan Revolusi Nasional. Two insurgents were later killed by the police.[119][120][121]

Three soldiers were left injured when separatist gunmen attacked a school in the area of Kumba, in Cameroon’s Southwest. The army blamed armed separatists for the attack. Several separatists are said to have been neutralized and wounded.[122]
Insurgents attacked a village in Mocímboa da Praia, with machetes, killing 3 people and injuring a fourth person severely as well as burning six homes.[123]
A local village chief was killed by Islamic State militants in Western Mosul. The victim of the attack was the chief of the Haramat village.[124]

12 civilians were killed and 2 were injured when militants attacked the town of Gasseliki in Burkina Faso. The militants also caused significant damage to the town, most of these attacks are attributed to the Al-Qaeda branches of Ansar-ul-Islam or JNIM.[125][126][127]
Six soldiers killed and 12 people were injured when a drone rigged with explosives by Houthi rebels exploded above the Al Anad Air Base in Yemen.[128][129]

location: Kunduz Province, Baghlan Province, Takhar Province and Badghis Province, Afghanistan
details: Taliban attacks in Kunduz killed 10 soldiers and police while 11 were wounded. 25 attackers were also killed. 16 pro-government militiamen were killed with Taliban also taking losses in Baghlan and Takhar. Six members of Afghan security forces were killed and 10 injured in Badghis.[130][131]

Two policemen sustained injuries when unidentified militants attacked their vehicle with an improvised explosive device (IED). Also, the Bomb Disposal Unit (BDU) defused two other IEDs planted at the roadside.[132]
Amidst uproar over the McJesus statue, the Haifa Museum of Art was firebombed twice between 10 January and 11 January. A protest by local Christians on the 11th became violent.[133][134][135]
Two Iraqis were killed and 25 others were injured in a car bomb blast outside a public market in the town of Al-Qaim. The Islamic State is presumed to be behind the attack.[136][137]
A member of the security forces was found dead and beheaded in a market at the town of Gharanij. It is believed that the attack was perpetrated by ISIL cells.[138][139]

A terrorist was shot and eliminated by alert IDF forces after attempting to carry out a stabbing attack. IDF soldiers spotted the terrorist, called to him to stop, and when the terrorist was meters away and brandishing a knife, they eliminated him. No injuries were reported among the troops.[140]
A popular broadcaster was kidnapped by unknown gunmen. The abductors stormed his house while he was preparing for work.[141]

Two security forces belonging to Manbij, were killed by a roadside bomb, when it had struck the vehicle it was traveling on. Another member was also injured and local sources attributed the attack to ISIL cells.[142][143]

Charity workers campaigning against terrorism were targeted in an attack in Loralai. The gunmen on motorcycles opened fire on the workers, killing one and injuring four others. No group claimed responsibility but the Tehrik-i-Taliban group has claimed numerous attacks in the area in the past.[144]
Four people were killed and six others were injured in an attack by militants on civilians near Mocimboa da Praia.[145]

Assailants attacked a police station in the Police District 6 in the city of Herat, killing 5 people including three civilians and two policemen as well as injuring 4 others. One of the assailants were killed in the attack. The Taliban is suspected for the attack.[146][147][148]
9 soldiers were left wounded when an IED exploded during an encounter with New People's Army rebels, in San Jorge, Samar.[149][150]
A bomb explosion killed a woman and injured two children in southwestern Kirkuk.[151]

Two people were killed and five others were injured when unknown attackers hurled a hand grenade at the residence of Deynile district commissioner, in Somalia's capital Mogadishu. No group claimed responsibility but Al-Shabaab often does attacks like these.[152]
Seven security personnel were killed and 9 Taliban were killed, when the Taliban attempted to storm a security checkpoint in Jowzjan's Aqcha District.[153][154]
A policeman was shot dead by multiple gunmen on motorcycles believed to be insurgents. The attack occurred at a police station in Pattani's Khok Pho District.[155]
Unknown gunman killed three people in Jema'a, Kaduna. One person died on the spot and the two others died the next morning in hospital.[156]

Boko Haram militants loyal to the Islamic State attacked the town of Rann in the Borno State. The militants overran the town, took control of it and set many buildings ablaze. 14 people were killed and several others were injured in the attack, thousands of Nigerian soldiers and civilians fled and abandoned the area the attack.[157][158][159][160]
An on duty cop was killed by an explosive device detonation in the Hawija District. The Islamic State group most of the times is responsible for these type of attacks.[161]
A member of the pro-government Popular Mobilization Forces was killed in an Islamic State attack on a security checkpoint in Kirkuk.[162]
An FSA fighter was killed and two others were left critically injured due a landmine explosion in Syria's Tell Rifaat District. The landmine had been placed by YPG militants.[163]

Four people were killed and 113 were left injured in a massive car bomb blast outside a building of foreign contractor in the city of Kabul. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the bombing.[164][165][166]

Two people were wounded in a car bomb explosion outside a popular restaurant in Mogadishu. No group has claimed responsibility for the bombing, but attacks like are most of the times blamed on the Al-Shabaab group.[167]
A roadside bomb struck a police convoy in Sinai. One person was killed and four others were seriously wounded. No group has claimed the responsibility, but Islamic State is suspected.[168]

2019 Nairobi hotel attack: At least one suicide bomber stormed the luxury complex DusitD2 hotel in Nairobi and detonated his explosives. Several gunmen took hostages and attacked the hotel with firearms. At least 21 people were killed including a British and an American citizen, 28 other people were injured and five attackers were also killed.[169][170][171][172][173][174]

A car driver was killed in Kabul's PD9, when a magnetic bomb exploded while attached to the car. The Islamic State group claimed responsibility and said that the person killed was an Afghan intelligence officer.[175][176]
Four people were injured in a bomb explosion in the Lohardaga District. The bomb had been placed by the Maoists to target police officers.[177]
Three policemen were injured in an Islamic State attack on a security checkpoint in the area of Khanaqin.[178]
Two villagers were shot and killed by Maoists in the Giridih district; it is said that the Maoists believed that the villagers were police informers.[179][180]
A person was killed when a bomb hidden inside a container in a garbage dump went off. The incident took place in Iraqi Kurdistan's Erbil.[181]

A Canadian man was kidnapped and later killed by suspected terrorists in the northern part of Burkina Faso, Yagha Province. The man worked for a mining company in the area, it is the second kidnapping of a Canadian national in the same area in recent months.[182][183]
5 Afghan soldiers were killed in a Taliban attack on a mosque in Faryab's Qaysar District, afterwards, an airstrike killed 7 Taliban militants in a nearby District.[184]
36 passengers were kidnapped by unknown gunmen. The kidnappers stole money, phones and other belongings. The next day the passengers were released. The abduction is blamed on armed separatists.[185]
34 Tuaregs were killed in attacks by unknown gunmen in the Ménaka Region. The attacks consisted of gunmen on motorcycles opening gunfire on the Tuaregs in two villages.[186][187][188][189]
2019 Manbij bombing: 19 people were killed in a suicide bomb attack perpetrated by ISIL. US military announced four US personnel were among the dead, 3 US Service members were also wounded.[190][191]
A policeman was shot dead by FARC dissidents in Corinto. The attack occurred as the policeman was performing surveillance duties.[192][193]
Six border policemen were injured when members of the Arakan Rohingya Salvation Army, set up an ambush and attacked a guard post near the town of Maungdaw.[194]
A military leader of the Syrian Democratic Forces was killed when his vehicle was bombed in the countryside of Deir ez-Zor. The attack is believed to have been done by ISIL cells.[195][196]
A shepherd was killed and another one was injured when militant terrorists set up a fake checkpoint in the Aïn Defla Province, and later attacked when the persons went in.[197][198]
Four policemen were killed in an attack by Taliban infiltrators in the Kandahar's Panjwayi District. The infiltrators opened gunfire on the policemen, killing four and later fleeing.[199][200]

Islamic militants kidnapped a christian man in the north part of the Sinai, the police later tried to rescue the man and were met with the militants which resulted in a shootout in which a militant was killed and two others were injured. Two policeman were also injured and the man was not able to be rescued.[201]
Islamic State militants stormed a hospital in Rafah and burnt two ambulance vehicles.[202][203]

The district police chief of the Shinwari District was killed in a Taliban attack, two other people were also injured. The attack happened as the police were trying to find a judge who had been kidnapped by the Taliban.[204]

2019 Bogotá car bombing: In the Colombian capital city of Bogotà, 20 people were killed and 68 others were injured when a car entered a police school compound. When it was stopped by guards at a checkpoint, the driver accelerated and hit a wall, and the car exploded.[205][206][207][208]
perpetrator: José Aldemar Rodríguez, aka Mocho Kiko (ELN)

details: Four policemen were injured in a grenade attack by militants in the Rajbagh area of Srinagar, the Jaish-e-Mohammed group claimed responsibility for the attack.[209][210]

Three Nigerian soldiers were killed when the soldiers were attacked by Boko Haram in the town of Gamboru. According to the army, the troops later "decimated" many terrorists, including two suicide bombers and recovered many weapons.[211][212]

Six Nigerian soldiers were killed and 14 others were injured when Boko Haram attacked an army position overnight in Kamuya, this village is located near the army chief’s family home. Four army vehicles were seized by the terrorists and two other vehicles were destroyed.[213]

A woman was attacked with a knife in a supermarket in Oslo. A young Russian man from the republic of Bashkortostan was detained right after the attack. The woman was critically injured and was taken to the hospital. The police investigate possible links to Islamist extremism. According to police, the suspected assailant said the attack was an act of terror and that he also intended to use a car by ramming into innocent people.[214]
A man suspected of assisting in the arrest of an Abu Sayyaf member was shot and later beheaded by suspected members of the group.[215]

The Taliban attacked a large military convoy in Faryab's Shirin Tagab District, the attackers killed 10 soldiers and injured 5, while also taking hostage 2 soldiers. The Taliban also set on fire at least 20 armored vehicles.[216]
Seven policemen were killed and 3 others were wounded in a Taliban attack on a checkpoint in an area outside of Kunduz city.[217]

An Ethiopian troop convoy came under an attack by Al-Shabaab militants in the Burhakaba and began when it was struck by an IED, reinforcements were sent which were was also bombed and attacked. According to reports, the confrontation was one of the most deadliest ever and dozens of Ethiopian troops were killed and scores more were injured, although the amount of injured is unknown. Al-Shabaab claimed 57 Ethiopian soldiers were killed. Helicopters later attacked an Al-Shabaab base. Ethiopian forces denied the reports and Al-Shabaab claims about the Burkhaba ambush. It added that four militants were killed, three soldiers and unknown number of militants were injured.[218][219][220][221]

15 people were killed and 20 others were wounded in a massive explosion that targeted a Tahrir-al-Sham headquarters in the city Idlib. According to reports, the cause of the explosion was due to a car bombing.[222][223]
Unknown perpetrators threw a grenade at a police camp in Shopian, India. No injuries were reported. Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) claimed responsibility for the attack.[224][225]
An Indonesian soldier was killed in a shootout and ambush by insurgents in Papua's Puncak Jaya Regency.[226]
Five army rangers and two policemen were injured in bomb blasts in the provinces of Pattani and Narathiwat. The bombings are suspected to have been done by separatists.[227][228]
Two Buddhist monks were shot dead and two others were injured in a militant attack on a Buddhist temple in Narathiwat's Sungai Padi district.[229][230]
A person was killed, 3 were wounded, and 6 others were captured, in a Taliban attack on a wedding ceremony in Helmand's Nad Ali District.[231]
A prominent business man was killed by suspected separatists. In a response security forces killed six suspected separatists.[232]
Islamic State attacked Egyptian security forces, killing three. They also captured a Christian criminal research expert.[233]
100 houses were burnt down by Boko Haram in the village of Aschigachia, in the far north area of Cameroon. No one was killed or injured in the attack.[234]
An oil pipeline belonging to Ecopetrol was bombed by a group of ELN members in Nariño Department.[235]

8 soldiers were killed when Al-Shabaab launched a complex attack on a military base on the outskirts of the town of Kismayo. The attackers used car bombs and guns in the attack, after taking over the military base the attackers set it on fire  and looted the camp.[236]
A woman was killed and 6 others were injured as a result of a bomb explosion that targeted a car in the city of Idlib.[237][238]
A levies personnel was killed in a bomb blast in the district of Chitral in Khyber Pakthunwa.[239][240]
A car bomb exploded in the center of Derry, Northern Ireland. Nobody was hurt in the bombing and police is investigating Irish militants who may have carried out the attack.[241][242]
Islamic State killed two Iraqi policemen in an attack on a checkpoint near the village of Sherbag at night.[243]
A bomb exploded outside a military intelligence office in Damascus, no one was killed or injured and a terrorist is said to have been arrested.[244][245]
A bomb detonation in a bus killed 3 civilians and wounded 9 others in the Syrian city of Afrin. Turkish authorities suspect the YPG to be behind the attack.[246][247][248]

Ten UN peacekeepers were killed and 25 others were injured when Al-Qaeda linked jihadists attacked a UN peacekeeping base that houses Chadian peacekeepers, several terrorists were also killed, the attack took place in the area of Kidal.[249][250][251][252]

Eight police officers were killed and 10 others were injured when a suicide car bomber detonated near the governor's convoy in the area of Logar. No top officials were injured in the attack, the Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.[253][254]
Two pro-government paramilitary fighters were killed and another one was wounded in a shootout with Islamic State militants in the area of Baqubah.[255]

Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen attacked the community of Bare in the Numan Local Government Area; the militants burnt down a Catholic seminary and several other houses in the area. No one was killed in the attack.[256][257]

A Boko Haram attack on a Buni Yadi base in Yobe state using suicide car bomb and gun trucks was repelled. 4 soldiers were injured and five terrorists neutralised, other militants were injured and fled the area.[258][259][260]

An oil pipeline belonging to Ecopetrol, was bombed in the area of Nariño in Colombia, Ecopetrol did not say who was responsible for the bombing, although the ELN group often does attacks oil and energy infrastructure in the area.[261]

Four people were left injured when suspected Al-Shabaab gunmen attacked a Chinese construction site near the town of Garissa. The attack was repulsed because officers were called on time and several of the attackers were wounded.[262][263]
Suspected Boko Haram members ambushed and killed a motorist in the area of the Shattimari village of Konduga Local Government Area of Borno State.[264]
13 people were killed in an attack launched by 3R ("return, reclamation, reconciliation") gunmen in the weekend at the village of Zaoro Sangou in Mambéré-Kadéï.[265][266]

location: Haut-Uele, Democratic Republic of the Congo
details: A series of attacks by members of the LRA occurred in the province of Haut-Uele, in one attack three bikers came under an ambush leaving one of them seriously injured, their valuables were also taken away from them, in another attack, 15 people were kidnapped and had their valuables stolen away. According to a FARDC spokesman, tracking operations resulted in 5 dead of the LRA and several others injured in the area nearby.[267]
Armed Maoists damaged an iron ore slurry pipeline of Essar Steel with crowbars and hacksaw blades. Work in the plant had to be stopped after the incident.[268]
A Malian soldier was killed when presumed JNIM (Al-Qaeda) militants attacked a convoy in the area of Macina. The attackers also reportedly seized a vehicle.[269][270]

3 people belonging to the Syrian Democratic Forces were killed and another one was injured as a result of a bomb explosion, in a village in the suburbs of Raqqa. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.[271]

Maidan Shar attack: A defense ministry official stated that 126 security personnel were killed and around 70 others were injured, when the Taliban attacked a military checkpoint in Maidan Shar. The assault begun when an attacker rammed a vehicle full of explosives in the compound, then two other attackers stormed the compound and opened gunfire, before being killed.[272][273][274] NDS' reports however showed only 36 killed and 58 injured.[275]

5 members of the US-backed Syrian Democratic Forces, were killed when a Islamic State suicide car bomber detonated targeting a US and SDF convoy near the town of Al-Shaddadah according to a Syrian war monitor. But the Kurdish Asayish forces denied any casualties, reporting only material damage. No US troops were killed or injured in the attack.[276][277]
NPA rebels attacked a construction firm's offices in Barangay Maragondon of Real, Quezon. After taking the workers hostage, they burnt the site and some construction equipment along with trucks.[278]
Israeli soldiers shot dead a Palestinian man in an alleged stabbing attempt at the Huwara checkpoint in southern Nablus.[279]

Islamic State militants attacked a checkpoint near Abu Sayda town, in Diyala Province, killing one policemen and injuring another, an Islamic State sniper also killed a policeman at a checkpoint in the Imam Weis area.[280]
A woman was killed and 13 other people were injured when Houthis launched an attack on the Ash-Shamsi district in central Taiz.[281]
Maoists killed 3 villagers and kidnapped 5 others in the Gadchiroli district. The Maoists suspected that those killed were police informers.[282][283]
1 person was killed and 14 injured due to a car bombing in a busy intersection in the city of Latakia. Another bomb was disarmed per Syrian State TV.[284][285]

Two people were killed and 3 others were injured in a car bombing in the city of Mogadishu. The blast is said to have targeted Syrian Nationals, 2 Syrians were injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.[286][287]
An US soldier was killed by gunfire in the province of Urozgan. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.[288][289]

location: Masisi Territory, Democratic Republic of the Congo
details: In different attacks three people were killed, two women raped and four persons kidnapped by armed men.[290]
A grenade was thrown at the residence of MP Arfo Aden Ibrahim. He was not home at the time of the attack, but three family members have sustained wounds. There was no claim of responsibility.[291]
A policeman was killed and 3 others were injured in a suicide car bombing in the province of Kirkuk. The Islamic State group is in most cases behind these attacks.[292]

A car bomb exploded near a headquarter of the Turkish-backed Free Syrian Army (FSA) group, in Afrin. Three people were killed and several others including civilians were injured in the blast.[293][294]

Presumed members of the ELN attacked a police patrol in Anorí, with a grenade. The grenade blast occurred near a police station and resulted in none wounded, although a vehicle was effected by the blast.[295][296]
A suicide bomber was stopped from entering a mosque in Kabul. The attacker proceeded to detonate his vest and injure a person, there was no claim of responsibility from any group.[297]
Two children were left injured in a roadside bomb explosion located to the west of Fallujah, in the province of Anbar.[298]
A bomb disposal expert was killed and another one was injured in a roadside bombing in the Mohamnd District. Hizbul Ahrar claimed responsibility for the attack.[299][300]

Boko Haram attacked the village of Geidam in Yobe, killing 8 soldiers and causing injuries to multiple others, several terrorists were killed in the attack, the terrorists also looted several grocery stores and then burnt them.[301]

A person was killed and two others were injured in an attack by gunmen in the city of Bosaso. The attack targeted Christians and Ethiopian migrants, the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.[302][303]
Three people were killed when suspected Boko Haram fighters attacked the village of Manguirlda. The militants were trying to abduct a Western priest present in the local church.[304]
The Taliban attacked security posts in Baqal Village at night. Two security personnel were injured. Ten Taliban militants were killed, and 13 sustained injuries.[305]

A candidate from the APC was abducted in his house. Before the kidnapping the assailants killed a policeman. Later the kidnappers contacted with the family members of the candidate and demanded for N300M for his release.[306][307]
A series of bombings struck the area of Al-Bab and the surroundings, killing 3 civilians and wounding at least 8 others. The attacks have been accused on YPG.[308][309]

location: Uvira, Democratic Republic of the Congo
details: Three soldiers were killed by Mai-Mai militants in Uvira, after being surprised by the militants, the militants then afterwards looted the area.[310]

Islamic State militants launched an attack against US backed SDF Forces, in which 16 people were killed, 34 Islamic State militants were killed and 21 others were arrested in the attack, which occurred in the village of Baghuz.[311][312]
A car bomb exploded near the Russian embassy in Damascus. No person was killed, although 4 people were lightly wounded in the car bomb attack.[313][314]
Two people including an security officer were killed and 4 others were injured when Taliban gunmen attacked a playground in the Sayyad District.[315]

Militants attacked a police station in the province of Yagha, the militants ransacked the area and burnt a car and 3 other vehicles. The attack comes as an state of emergency was declared in the area due to terrorist attacks, the Al-Qaeda group JNIM claimed responsibility for the attack.[316][317]

location: North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo
details: 3 people were killed and 2 others were injured in an ambush attack by presumed ADF rebels in the province of North Kivu, on a highway that led to the city of Beni. Four vehicles were also damaged by bullets.[318]
Nine people including a child were injured when an explosive laden motorbike exploded as a Frontier Corps convoy was passing by in the area of Turbat. No group has claimed responsibility so far.[319]
Three servicemen were injured in attack on a border post in Muangdaw township. The General Administration Department blamed ARSA members.[320]
Two UN peacekeepers from Sri Lanka were killed and 3 others were injured when a MINUSMA vehicle struck a landmine in the area of Douentza.[321][322] JNIM claimed responsibility.[323]
perpetrator: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb

details: Gunmen attacked a market in Afgooye, killing 3 soldiers and killing 3 women who witnessed the attack. The Islamic State group claimed responsibility for the attack.[324][325]
18 people were killed and 23 others were injured when gunmen belonging to the "Union for Peace" group, attacked a funeral ceremony in the town of Ippy, overnight on Friday.[326][327]
Eight Somali soldiers were killed when their vehicle struck a roadside bomb in the area of Lower Juba. The attack was done by Al-Shabaab.[328][329]
A terrorist was killed when the terrorists tried to attack a police post in Tillakaina, in the Tillabery region; a Nigerien soldier was slightly wounded in the attack.[330]

Policemen were attacked by a gunman, in the settlement of Sernovodskoye (Kursky district), the shooting caused the injuries of two policemen, the policemen fired back, killing the attacker who's body was later found next to a Kalashnikov, in the forest. The Islamic State group claimed responsibility for the attack.[331][332]
Three cops and three civilians were injured when a bomb was detonated as policemen were on a patrol in the province of Yala.[333][334]

A series of bombings were carried out throughout Kashmir on eve of Indian Republic Day. A grenade attack on a police station in Anantnag injured a police officer and a civilian. Grenade attacks were also carried out on a CRPF bunker in Sopore and Tahab camp in Pulwama district without any reports of casualties. Two petrol bombs were carried out in Srinagar. Shots fired at a CRPF battalion in Midoora Awantipora caused no casualties. Two other reported attacks in Srigufwara, Srinagar. Jaish-e-Mohammed claimed responsibility, claiming carrying out eight grenade attacks.[335]
Five students were kidnapped from a school in Bamenda, and two lawyers were abducted in Buea. The kidnappers were heavily armed men. The government blamed armed separatists.[336]
Two people were injured when a bomb exploded in a luggage near a cinema in the city of Nairobi.[337][338]
A civilian and four Taliban militants were killed and 20 others were wounded when an IED exploded in a volleyball match in the Tala wa Barfak District. The Taliban was blamed for the blast.[339][340]
8 people were killed and 30 others were injured when Houthis shelled a displacement camp in the area of Harad.[341][342]

A university student was killed and 2 other people were injured when a magnetic bomb that was to attached to a car exploded in the city of Jalalabad. The Islamic State Khorasan Province (ISKP) claimed responsibility for the attack.[343][344][345]
More than 20 Syrian Soldiers were killed when Islamic State militants ambushed and launched an attack on a convoy in the area of Al-Rahba, near Mayadin.[346]
Three Iraqi servicemen and two policemen were injured in attack on a checkpoint at Khanaqin's entrance.[347]
Three Burundian soldiers serving under African Union peacekeeping were killed by a roadside bomb. Al Shabaab has claimed responsibility.[348]

Kurdish people stormed a Turkish base in Sheladize town in Derelok district. They set fire to military equipment in the base. Two Kurdish men were killed by Turkish soldiers. The attack was a protest against a Turkish bombardment in the area.[349][350]

A police officer and two others were killed in Benin city of Edo State. The state Police Commissioner said the attack is believed to have been mounted by a rival cultist group and initially alleged the dead policeman was a cultist, though later retracted the comment about him after threat of a suit saying it was for the courts to decide whether he was a cultist.[351][352]

2019 Jolo Cathedral bombings: 22 people, were killed and 102 others were injured when two bombs exploded in a cathedral during Sunday mass in Jolo, Philippines. The Islamic State-related branch of Abu Sayyaf terror group Ajang Ajang faction was behind the attack.[353][354]

Ten people were killed and 2 others were left severely injured when presumed JNIM or Islamic State Greater Sahara (ISGS) militants launched an attack on the village of Sikire in the province of Soum. Shops and businesses were ransacked and burnt, while at the same time the militants seized motorbikes.[355][356]

4 policemen and civilians were killed and 11 others were injured in bomb attacks that targeted police convoys near the town of Al-Shirqat. The Islamic State is believed to be behind the attacks.[357][358]
Taliban gunmen shot and killed a prosecutor in the city of Kandahar.[359]
Five women committed suicide bombings in Baghouz village, killing one and injuring three.[360]

Boko Haram attack on a military base in Pulka was repelled. Islamic State claimed 30 dead soldiers and others injured in an attack on the base in Logomani village by Islamic State West Africa province faction. However, the Nigerian Army said only eight soldiers were injured and the attack was repelled.[361][362]
A suspected police informant kidnapped by Maoists died after they beat him to death with sticks. His corpse was dumped in Gadchiroli.[363]
A couple was killed in an attack by gunmen in an attack that appeared similar to Islamic State attacks.[364]
A bomb explosion in the province of Sidi Bel Abbès left 2 Algerian soldiers injured; the condition of the soldiers is now stable.[365]

A cameraman and six civilians were killed and 26 others were injured when an explosive rigged motorbike exploded in the port city of Mocha. Officials at first suspected Al-Qaeda or Islamic State behind the attack. The attack was however later blamed on the Houthis.[366][367][368]

Four soldiers were killed and five others were injured when hundreds of militants stormed a military base in Nassoumbou. The militants fired rockets at the base; air support later arrived and killed an unspecified number of attackers. The attackers are believed to be from Al-Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb.[369][370]
Four people were killed and two others were abducted when Boko Haram attacked the village of Molai, in the Borno State.[371]
Islamic State terrorists killed 2 Iraqi farmers who were collecting truffles and kidnapped another in the Haditha District of Anbar.[372]
A car bombing in the rebel held city of Azaz left five people wounded.[373]

A Boko Haram attack on the town of Bosso of Niger, that borders Nigeria, left 4 people dead and 3 others injured. Several homes and three vehicles loaded with Red Pepper, were set on fire by the terrorists.[374][375]
Six policemen were killed and 3 others were left wounded, with one policeman also missing, when the Taliban attacked checkpoints in the Sholgara District, with RPG's and guns.[376][377]
A military vehicle struck a mine in the commune of Matomo, killing a policeman and injuring 2 others.[378]
A police officer was killed and eight injured due to two roadside bombs triggered by NPA members in Magpet.[379]
60 people were killed when Boko Haram attacked the town of Rann once again, the terrorists did a mass burning event, killing 60 people, and destroying many structures.[380][381]

A British man named Anthony Thomas Cox was attacked by two Islamic States inmates in the central prison of Mogadishu with razor blades. He was arrested after suspicious items believed to be tear gas canisters were found in his luggage at the airport.[382]

In an attack on an ammunition-laden vehicle near Afrin, two Turkish soldiers and one mercenary were killed. One soldier and three mercenaries were wounded, the vehicle and the ammunition were destroyed. In an other attack in the village of Dermishmish two soldiers of the Ahrar al-Sham were killed and three were wounded.[383]
A mine exploded at a tractor. Two people were killed. It is unknown wo placed the mine.[384]

A female suicide bomber targeted the governing council of the Syrian Salvation Government in Idlib. Islamic State is suspected to be behind the attack.[385][386] However it has denied responsibility for the attack.[387]
A bombing targeted an area near the Al-Watani hospital in Raqqa, controlled by the SDF, the bombing wounded five people.[388][389]
A SDF member was killed in Al-Bohmid village in western Deir Ez-zor by insurgent cells.[390]
Two people were killed and five others were injured in a car bombing near the Somali Petroleum Ministry and the responsibility was claimed by Al-Shabaab.[391][392]

2019 Loralai attack: 9 people including civilians and policemen were killed and 22 others were injured when gunmen and suicide bombers attacked a Deputy Inspector General (DIG) office in Pakistan's Loralai, the Tehrik-i-Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.[393][394]

Two Malian soldiers were killed and 10 others were wounded in a complex attack that involved a suicide car bomb attack on a base in the village of Tarkint, the Al-Qaeda affliate JNIM, claimed responsibility for the attack.[395][396][397]
A counter terrorism officer was shot and killed by multiple gunmen in an targeted attack in Dera Ismail Khan, no group has claimed responsibility yet for the attack.[398][399]
Three policemen were wounded in a double bombing near a police station in the Iranian city of Zahedan, the Jaish al-Adl group claimed responsibility for the attack.[400][401][402]

Three people were killed and a fourth one was injured when multiple gunmen attacked a coffee shop in Tarmiyah, with assault rifles. No group claimed responsibility but the Islamic State is in most cases responsible for attacks like these.[403]
Suspected Islamic State attackers killed a policeman in an attack on a checkpoint in al-Dibis district.[404]
A roadside bomb ripped through a military car in Manbij, severely injuring the driver. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.[405][406][389]
Maoists burnt a bus and assaulted its driver and conductor. No passenger was hurt in the attack.[407]
A driver of a CRPF supply vehicle was injured due to arrows shot at the vehicle by Maoists.[408]
Suspected Maoists burnt a bus during observance of the "Maoist Week" in Sarivela village. No passenger was harmed.[409]

Two victims sleeping inside a mosque died and four others were injured due to a grenade attack. A regional task force commander said that the attack was not a retaliatory act for the Jolo bombings.[410]

An Islamic State cell assassinated a member of the Syrian Democratic Forces, in Raqqa, the attack came after a bombing in the area caused the injuries to 5 people, the gunmen are believed to be part of insurgent cells.[411][389]
Four people including two foreign engineers were injured when a roadside bomb exploded near Mogadishu.[412]
A tribal elder and his son were left severely injured when an explosive device exploded near their vehicle in Mirali.[413]
SDF members were targeted at the Theban checkpoint by an Islamic state terror cell, resulting in an unspecified number of injuries.[414]
2 Asayish personnel were killed and another injured in assassinations by unknown gunmen in Makhroum to south of al-Hasakah city.[414]
A suspected police informant abducted by the Maoists a week ago was found dead, making it the fifth killing by them in Bhamragad taluka in a week.[415]
Houthis shelled a public school in Taiz, killing a student and injuring another. They also targeted the city center.[416]
A Nigerian military convoy was attacked by Boko Haram terrorists loyal to the Islamic State near the town of Dikwa. Eight soldiers were killed and one was still missing.[417]
An Egyptian member of Hayat Tahrir al-Sham who is also a preacher in a mosque was abducted and killed in the countryside of Maarrat al-Nu'man.[418]
A Palestinian teen girl tried to stab an Israeli security officer with a knive at a checkpoint outside Jerusalem. The girl was shot dead by the police.[419]

Militants attacked a military facility in the east of Burkina Faso. At least one person was injured, and several vehicles were set on fire. The JNIM claimed responsibility, and said at least ten soldiers were killed or injured.[420]
Five civilians and 2 police officers were injured when a group of terrorists hurled a grenade on the security forces. Police suspect Jaish-e-Mohammed could be behind the attack.[421][422]

A landmine was triggered by Maoists in Chatikona village of Rayagada district in front of a truck without any resulting casualties. A construction machine was also set ablaze in Kendughati of Kalahandi district.[423]
Two earth movers and four trucks were torched by Maoists in Potegaon area of Gadchiroli district. Another truck was torched in Bedgaon, Korchi tehsil.[424]
Two women were injured when an IED was thrown at near a deployment of Syrian soldiers by unknown attackers.[425]
Six soldiers were killed and seven others were injured in a Taliban attack on check posts in Thursday night, 9 Taliban were killed and 13 others were injured, in the gun-battle.[426][427]

A mother and two of her children were killed, and four others were injured, when an explosive device exploded during a picnic, near Tikrit. The Islamic State group has made attacks similar to these.[1][2]
Militants shot and killed a woman in the Shopian District. The militants also made a video of the incident.[3][4]

location: Tshikapa, Democratic Republic of the Congo
details: A 74-year-old man succumbed to his injuries after being severely beaten by militiamen belonging to Kamwina Nsapu. The incident occurred in Tshikapa. The man was beaten in February 1 but died in February 3.[5]

Unknown gunmen opened fire at a Syrian Army checkpoint, in the town of Nahtah, in Daraa countryside, no person was killed or injured in the attack, no group claimed responsibility for the attack, although some information blamed the attack on Islamic State or Tahrir al Sham.[6]

A bomb exploded near the house of a Kurdish-led militia commander in Manbij. The bomb blast caused material damage, but not fatalities. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.[7][8][9]
Six civilians were shot dead by Boko Haram terrorists in the village of Bague Djaradi, in Toumour, Niger.[10][11]
Two men were shot in "paramilitary style attacks" in the Ballymagroarty area of Derry, in Northern Ireland.[12][13]
Three Frontier Corps personnel were injured in a roadside bomb explosion in Chaman, Pakistan.[14]
Three Syrian soldiers were killed and another was reported wounded in an attack by jihadists in southwest Aleppo.[15]
One person was killed and five others were injured, when a bus struck a roadside bomb that was carrying teachers in Manbij.[16][17]
A suicide car bomb attack outside a military base, left two people dead, the attack also wounded five more. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.[18][19]
An IRGC member was killed and five others were injured in an attack on a paramilitary base in Nik Shahr. The Jaish-al-Adl group claimed responsibility for the attack.[20][21]
An Iraqi border guard was killed and another one was wounded in an attack by Islamic State militants on a security post to the southeast of Al-Qaim, in Al Anbar Governorate.[22]
Two people were left injured when a bomb exploded in the city of Jalalabad, in East Afghanistan. No group has claimed responsibility for the incident.[23][24]
Militants gunned down a deputy district governor in Sar-e Pol's Gosfandi District. The Taliban is yet to claim responsibility for the attack.[25]

Islamic State militants launched an attack on an oil police checkpoint in the town of Buhriz, killing a policeman and wounding another one. An attack was also reported in an area nearby, but the attack was repelled and no casualties were reported.[26]
Two security officers were killed in the Faryab Province when the Taliban attacked the security forces. The gun battle killed three Taliban and left five injured.[27][28]
Three villagers were shot and killed after being kidnapped by the Islamic State in Hafta Ghar, Daquq District. The militants made a video of the attack.[29][30]
An Iraqi poet who criticized militias was shot and killed by two attackers in the Iraqi city of Karbala. The gunmen shot the poet at least 13 times before fleeing.[31][32]
Two people were shot dead in an attack carried out by Maoists in Dhanora tehsil of Gadchiroli district.[33]
Two soldiers were injured when ELN tried to assassinate the mayor of Saravena through a rigged motorbike in La Pajuila village of Arauca Department.[34]
An alleged FARC dissident was arrested and admitted his involvement in the killing a policeman in Arauca department as well as other terrorist attacks.[35]

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a member of the Syrian Democratic Forces in the village of Darnaj, in the province of Deir ez-Zor. The gunmen are believed to be part of insurgent cells and two alleged members of the Islamic State were arrested on a town nearby.[36]
A person was killed and three others were injured when a bomb struck a bus carrying tourists in the Balad District.[37]
Fourteen civilians were killed in an attack on a village in the province of Yantenga; as a result, the army retaliated and reportedly killed 146 jihadists.[38][39]
2019 Mogadishu bombing: A car bombing at a shopping mall in the city of Mogadishu left 11 people killed and 10 others injured. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.[40][41]
Gunmen shot and killed a senior representative of Dubai-based harbor operator DP World Ltd, in Bosaso town. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.[42][43]

Three members of the Syrian Democratic Forces were found dead after being executed by "a sharp tool" at a water station in the town of Tayyana, Deir ez-zor Province. The most likely perpetrators are Islamic State militants.[44]
An IED targeted a vehicle belonging to the Asayish personnel in Raqqa. The bombing left several wounded.[45]

Three people were killed when Boko Haram three communities in the Madagali area, the militants destroyed 20 shops and 3 cars, and took away with moveable properties, including a utility van. The militants later left when a gun-battle with the army ensued in the area.[46]
Ten people were killed and four others were injured when Taliban gunmen attacked a pro-government militia in Samangan's Dara-I-Suf District.[47]
A Taliban attack on the province of Baghlan, left ten security personnel killed and five others wounded, with four Taliban being killed and five others wounded.[48][49]
Twenty-eight security personnel were killed and twenty others were injured in a Taliban attack on a check-post in the province of Kunduz.[50][51]
Five policemen were killed and three others were injured in an attack by presumed JNIM terrorists in the Oursi Department. The army launched a counteroffensive, killing 21 terrorists.[52][53][54]

Two Afghan journalists were shot and killed by gunmen in Taluqan, the journalists worked for Radio Hamsada and were shot and killed in their radio station. Taliban and other insurgents have targeted journalists in the past.[55]

A policeman was shot and killed by multiple gunmen in a targeted killing in the city of Jalalabad. The gunmen took the man's weapon away and the Islamic State took responsibility for the attack.[56][57]
Four policemen were injured in an ambush and shooting attack on a police checkpoint in the New Valley Governorate. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.[58][59]

Three Syrian soldiers were killed when unknown gunmen detonated an explosive device on a Syrian Army checkpoint in the Daraa province, a Syrian rebel group called Popular resistance claimed responsibility for the attack and published a video.[60][61][62]
Two senior Somali officials were killed in a bomb explosion in a village located to the south of Mogadishu. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.[63]
Three soldiers were injured in a Boko Haram attack on the Far North Region of Cameroon, several terrorists escaped with injuries in a shootout that ensued.[64]
A car bomb exploded close to a jail in Manbij; the bombing left no one killed or injured.[65][66]
A public transport vehicle struck a landmine in Dagana at the commune of Haire, Douentza district, three people were killed and twelve others were left injured as a result of the bomb blast.[67][68]
Shelling from militants left a Syrian soldier killed and another one injured. The shelling targeted Zahra in the Aleppo province.[69][70]
Six soldiers were reportedly killed when Al-Shabaab launched mortars on a military base near Kismayo.[71]
A suspected police informant was abducted and shot dead by CPI (Maoist) members in Bhamragad tehsil of Gadchiroli district.[72]

Four people including three security officers and a civilian were injured in a grenade attack targeting the officers in Imphal.[73][74] The United National Liberation Front claimed responsibility, a member of the group was arrested as a suspect.[75][76]
Seven people were beheaded and four others, including three girls, were kidnapped in an attack by insurgents in the village of Quiterajo in the Macomia District.[77][78]
Six policemen were killed and eight others were wounded when the Taliban attacked a checkpoint in the Nimruz province. Several Taliban fighters were also killed, but the number was not specified.[79]
Two civilians were killed in an attack by terrorists on a gendarmerie brigade in Kongoussi, Burkina Faso.[80]
A six year old boy was killed by a taxi driver with a piece of broken glass in front of his mother. The boy was killed when the taxi driver found out he was a Shia Muslim.[81]
Three brothers were kidnapped by Islamic State militants on Thursday, and were later executed by the militants, in an area of Saladin Governorate.[82]

location: Beni, Democratic Republic of the Congo
details: Seven people were killed, when ADF rebels attacked civilians and army positions in the area of Beni in North Kivu. The militants wielded guns and machetes at the victims.[83][84]
Seven civilians were killed and another one was left injured, when a landmine exploded in an area east of Salamiyah. The incident was blamed on militants who used to inhabit the area.[85]

Three Nigerian soldiers were killed in a Boko Haram attack on a military base at the Ngwom village, Borno State. The terrorists also burnt two houses and a car and left with two army vehicles.[86][87]
Three security officers were injured when a bomb exploded in the Mirali tehsil. The area was cordoned and a search operation was launched to find the perpetrators.[88]
Three Afghan soldiers were killed and nine others wounded in a Taliban attack on a base in the Sari Pul province. Three Taliban were killed and seven others were wounded in the attack.[89]
An intelligence officer was shot and killed in Kabul by multiple gunmen. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.[90]

Islamic State militants launched an attack on Syrian forces positions near an oilfield in the Deir ez-Zor province. The attack was repelled with 10 assailants being killed and 2 others fleeing.[91][92]
A soldier and a local tribal chief were killed in Boko Haram attacks in Madagali, a gun-battle ensued in which three terrorists were also killed.[93]
A logger was shot and killed by gunmen believed to be of Abu Sayyaf, the incident occurred in Maluso, Basilan.[94]
Two bomb disposal officers were killed when a bomb they were trying to defuse exploded in the city of Hīt. The bomb had been planted by terrorists.[95][96]
Eight policemen were killed in an insider attack in the Sargodar area of Lashkargah. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.[97]
An Islamic State attack near the Qaradar village of Dubiz district, killed a policeman and injured two others.[98]
Eleven people were wounded in a grenade attack on a patrol party in the city of Srinagar. Among the wounded were four civilians and seven security personnel.[99][100]

2019 Kaduna State massacre: An attack on an Adara settlement named Ungwar Bardi by suspected Fulani gunmen killed 11. Reprisal attack by an Adara militia targeted settlements of the Fulani. The death toll rose to 141 a few days later with 11 Adara and 130 Fulani dying per the government. The governor spoke that the motive was to destroy specific communities. The attacks took place in Kajuru LGA of Kaduna State. Miyetti Allah was reported to have published a list of 131 dead, but later clarified that 66 Fulani were buried and 65 remain missing.[101][102][103][104][105]
An Iraqi border guard was killed and another one was wounded in an Islamic State attack on a security checkpoint on the outskirts of Khanaqin.[106]
Three people from the same family were killed and eleven others were injured when a mortar struck their home in the Dashti Qala District, the incident was blamed on the Taliban.[107]
Suspected ELN guerrillas bombed the Caño Limón–Coveñas pipeline in Teorama municipality of Norte de Santander Department overnight..[108][109]
Mansoya-Orito pipeline in Orito municipality of Putumayo department was bombed in the afternoon which the Colombian army blamed on FARC dissidents.[110][111]
An Egyptian soldier and a recruiter were killed when Islamic State snipers opened fire on them in an area near Rafah in Egypt. Several other recruits were also injured in the incident.[112][113]

Four policemen were killed and 3 other people were injured in a shooting attack on a police vehicle by militants in Dera Ismail Khan. The Hizbul-Ahrar group claimed responsibility for the attack.[114][115]
A patrol vehicle was ambushed in the Mopti Region, killing 3 policemen and injuring 2 others, in the same day, militants shot and killed a customs officer in an area nearby.[116]
The head of a local council in a neighborhood in Raqqa was shot and killed in the city of Raqqa by presumed Islamic State gunmen.[117]
A Somali police officer was killed when a bomb placed in his car exploded in the Somali capital of Mogadishu.[118]

Four people were killed when separatists gunmen set on fire a hotel and started shooting in the air in Kumba. Seven vehicles belonging to personnel of the hospital were also burnt down in the attack.[119]
A car bomb exploded at a checkpoint in the town of Al-Rai, Syria, injuring three people. No group has claimed responsibility yet for the incident.[120][121]
Maoists executed a suspected police informant in Venosh village of Nabarangpur district by slitting his throat.[122]

Suspected Boko Haram insurgents ambushed and attacked a campaign convoy of the Borno State governor.
