At least five people were killed and dozens of others were left missing.[123][124] Survivors however disputed the official numbers. A morgue received 60 bodies and it is unknown if the attackers were killed too. An international security official put the number of abducted to 100, but a Nigerian intelligence official said 200 people were kidnapped.[125]

A bomb exploded inside the  Santísimo de la Catedral of Ecatepec. The Individualistas Tendiendo a lo Salvaje group is suspected being responsible, though it has denied having any hand behind it and blamed it on another group called Conspiración del Trueno.[126][127]
Four security personnel were injured when a suicide bomber targeted their convoy in the Mastung District.[128]
Two policemen and a civilian were killed in an attack on a market in the village of Bagaji, Dogondoutchi District. The attack is suspected to have been done by Jihadists.[129][130]

Three fuel vendors were killed when gunmen opened gunfire on them in the Inahare area of Menaka. Afterwards, the gunmen were chased down by security forces and a clash was caused resulting in two dead of the security forces and two dead of the gunmen. The attack is suspected to have been done by the Islamic State Greater Sahara (ISGS).[131]
Three Yemeni civilians were killed when a bomb exploded in the Yemeni city of Hodeidah. The attack was blamed on Houthis.[132][133]

A car bombing targeted a Somali lawmaker, in Mogadishu, killing the driver and injuring 2 others. The lawmaker escaped the attack unscathed as he was not in the vehicle at the time. No group has claimed responsibility yet for the attack.[134]

An Islamic State attack on a police outpost near the Imam Weis area, in Diyala Governorate, killed a policeman and injured another. The militants also suffered an unknown number of casualties when reinforcements arrived.[135]
Three UAE-backed Yemeni security personnel, were killed when a roadside bomb struck their vehicle in the district of Al Mahfad. Al-Qaeda was blamed for the attack.[136]

Iran Khash-Zahedan suicide bombing: A suicide car bomb attack on a bus carrying Iranian paramilitary revolutionary guard soldiers killed 27 soldiers and injured 13 others. Jaish-al-Adl took responsibility for the attack, which took place somewhere in the Sistan and Baluchestan province.[137][138][139]
A tribal elder was killed when an IED struck the vehicle he was traveling in the district of Mirali, North-west Pakistan.[140]

2019 Pulwama attack: 40 personnel belonging to Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) were killed when a suicide car bomber rammed an explosive laden vehicle on a convoy in the Pulwama District. Around two dozen others were also injured in the attack. Jaish-e-Mohammed claimed responsibility for the attack. Several other vehicles were damaged in the powerful blast.[141][142]

Eight members of the Popular Mobilization Units (PMU), including a group leader, were killed when their convoy was struck by two roadside bombs in the province of Saladin. Seven other personnel were also injured in the bomb attacks.[143][144]

Five people including a Jordanian farmer and four security officers were killed and eight others were injured when a homemade bomb exploded in the town of Al-Salt, Jordan. An investigation found that the device was matching that of the pro-Islamic State terrorist cell which had attacked the area in August of 2018.[145][146][147][148]
A booby trapped corpse exploded, killing 2 soldiers and injuring 6 others in the area of Djibo. Most of these attacks are attributed to Al-Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb groups.[149][150][151]
Two soldiers were killed and four NPA rebels were killed in an NPA raid on an army detachment in the Malaybalay City.[152]
A military intelligence officer was shot and killed by a sniper in the outskirts of Tafas, Daraa. A group named "Popular Resistance" claimed responsibility for the attack.[153]

Nine border officers were killed and two others were wounded when the Taliban attacked their checkpoints in the Shorabak District. Sixteen Taliban were killed and nine others were injured in the ensuing clashes.[154]

A Taliban attack on a security post in the Spinboldak District, left 32 troops dead in the post. The attack began when a Taliban attacker sneaked into the base and shot and killed an officer, afterwards a Taliban attacker rammed his explosive-laden vehicle into the base, then the attackers opened gunfire on the post once they were inside, no one in the base survived the attack. The attackers then looted the base and then fled.[155]

Five customs officers were killed when Jihadists militants attacked the customs station in Nohao. The militants also burnt down the station and three vehicles. In the area nearby, a vehicle carrying a Spanish priest was intercepted and the priest was shot and killed by the militants.[156][157]

Eight civilians were kidnapped by Islamic State militants in the province of Anbar. The first kidnapping was 5 kidnapped in the area of Rawah; the second kidnapping took place 80 kilometers west of the city of Haditha.[158]
Three civilians and two policemen were injured when an explosive device targeted a security patrol near the al-Istiqama mosque in Giza, the attack was blamed on the Muslim Brotherhood.[159]
A vehicle carrying MSA fighters in Talataye struck an explosive device, killing a fighter and injuring 3 others. The area often features attacks of the Al-Qaeda group JNIM.[160]

Seven Nigerien soldiers were killed and six others were injured when heavily armed Boko Haram terrorists launched a raid on the army post in Chetima Wanou, in the country's southeast area. Several terrorists were killed including a corpse left on the spot and 8 others terrorists were captured.[161][162]
3 Boko Haram suicide bombers killed 8 people and injured 15 others in Maiduguri. The terrorists also shot and the residents during the attack.[163][164][165]

15 soldiers were killed or wounded when terrorists attacked a checkpoint in the North Sinai Province. Seven terrorists are also said to have been killed in the exchange of fire. According to medical sources, 11 soldiers were killed in the attack.[166][167]
A bomb placed on a vase exploded, killing a civilian and injuring 3 others in the city of Ghazni. The attack was blamed on the Taliban.[168][169]
An army officer was killed and another one was wounded in an IED blast in the Rajouri District.[170]
Two shepherds were killed and another one was wounded when a landmine placed by Islamic State militants blew up in the Al-Nassaf area near Fallujah.[171][172]
Two Frontier Corps personnel were killed and a passer by was injured in a shooting attack in Loralai. The Tehrik-i-Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.[173][174]
Three civilians including a child were killed when explosives planted on their vehicle blew up in Kandahar's Daman District. No group has been blamed yet for the attack.[175]
Abu Sayyaf fired mortars at a medical mission in Patikul Sulu, disrupting the mission. No one was hurt in the attack.[176]
An armed man shot and killed three members Syrian Democratic Forces in a market in the town of Diban. The SDF has accused the Islamic State of being behind similar operations.[177]
Six soldiers were injured when a military vehicle dodging bombs triggered by ELN collided with another vehicle in Palestina village in Tame municipality, located in Arauca Department.[178][179]

Four Nigerian soldiers were killed and five others were wounded in a Boko Haram attack on a military base in Buni Yadi, Yobe State. Five terrorists were also killed in the attack and their equipment was seized by the soldiers.[180][181]

Eight policemen were killed and three others were injured when the Taliban attacked a checkpoint in Balkh's Chimtal District. The attackers also used RPGs in the attack. Several Taliban attackers were killed and wounded in the attack, but the number was not known as the Taliban evacuated their casualties.[182]

2019 Balochistan attack :Six to Nine Frontier Corps personnel were killed and several others were injured in a shooting attack in the Turbat area of Balochistan. A group named BRAS claimed responsibility.[183][184][185]
Two Nigerian soldiers were killed and six others were injured in a Boko Haram attack on an army post near the town of Banki, Borno State.[186]
Two Iraqi civilians were shot and killed by Islamic State militants in the province of Kirkuk, al-Rashad District.[187]
A person was killed when a magnetic explosive device exploded in the Panshir Wat area at Kabul's PD11. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.[188][189]
Four civilians were killed when two female suicide bombers detonated their vests near a refugee camp in the town of Bosso. The attack is believed to have been done by Boko Haram.[190][191]

A roadside bomb struck a African Union armored personnel carrier in the city of Mogadishu, killing two policemen who were near the attack. No group has claimed responsibility, but Al-Shabaab often does attacks like these.[192]
A pharmacist was shot and killed by two ISIL gunmen on a motorbike, while he was on a car wash in the center of the city of Raqqa.[193]
An Iraqi child was killed and two of his family members were wounded when a landmine placed by Islamic State, blew up, while they were collecting truffles in the Haditha District.[194]

Five Indian soldiers including an army major were killed in a gunfight with militants in Pulwama, an army soldier was also critically wounded and three terrorists and one civilian was killed were killed in the shootout. The attack was done by Jaish-e-Mohammed.[195][196]

Islamic State militants kidnapped 12 Iraqis including five security personnel, while gathering desert truffles in the Umm al-Jedaan area, Anbar Province, afterwards, two of the kidnapped officers were later found dead. The fate of the others remains unknown and a search operation has been launched.[197]

location: North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo
details: Two civilians were shot and killed in an attack by ADF militants in the town of Mavivi in North Kivu, the attackers also clashed with the army for two hours during the attack.[198]

Twin bombings in Syria's Idlib, killed 24 people including 4 children and injured 51 others. The first bombing was a parked car who exploded, while the second one was when ambulances arrived to the area, a bike bomb exploded. No group has claimed responsibility, though both Syrian intelligence and Islamic State has been accused of such bombings in the past. Hayat Tahrir al-Sham has blamed Russian and Assad regimes of involvement.[199][200][201][202]

Three policemen were killed and three other people including a woman and two policemen, when a suicide bomber detonated his explosives while surrounded by the police near the Al-Azhar Mosque in Cairo.[203][204][205]
Eighteen firewood merchants were killed when they fell in an ambush attack by Boko Haram in the Koshebe, in Jere area.[206][207]

Two policemen were killed and another injured in an attack on the border bridge with the Venezuelan border. The Colombian defense minister has stated that ELN and FARC dissidents were suspected.[208][209]
Iraqi border guards discovered the bodies of six people who had been kidnapped in the Najaf Governorate on Monday.[210]
Two children were killed when a bomb went off while they were playing in an area of al-Nassaf, Anbar Province.[211]

Five people were killed and five were wounded with 9 others being kidnapped in Boko Haram attacks in the Bouboura and Ngasia, Lac region in Chad. The Chadian troops were searching for the attackers and their hostages.[212]

Two security officers were killed when Islamic State militants launched an attack on a checkpoint in the Qayyarah subdistrict. Four militants were also killed in the shootout while the rest escaped.[213]
Six civilians were killed when a roadside bomb struck a civilian vehicle in the Qarghayi District. So far no group has been blamed for the attack or has claimed responsibility.[214][215]

Four people including two civilians were killed when the Taliban opened fire on a convoy of a private company in the highway linking Jawzjan's provincial capital Shiberghan city to neighboring Mazar-e-Sharif. An official said that two Taliban militants were killed, although Aneq said that the militants took the vehicle to an unknown area.[216]

Two bombs struck an African Union vehicle in the town of Bardera. The attack caused heavy casualties but the toll was not able to be completely found. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack and claimed causing casualties on the Ethiopian troops.[217]
A Somali prosecutor was shot and killed by Al-Shabaab gunmen in the Hodan area of Mogadishu. The attackers then escaped with his vehicle. The group claimed responsibility.[218][219]

A GATIA officer was killed on Wednesday night by gunmen in a village near the town of Ingar in the Menaka region, the attackers also wounded the victim's wife and a family member, the attackers also looted the property and fled with the victim's car.[220]
Two people belonging to the Syrian Democratic Forces, were shot and killed by ISIL gunmen on a motorcycle in the village of al-Sabha in eastern Deir ez-Zor Province.[221]
Three civilians were killed and at least seven were injured when a Houthi fired mortar shell struck a popular market in Yemen's Hodeida.[222]
A policeman was shot and killed by terrorists presumed to belong to JNIM/ISGS in the Pama-Fada axis in the province of Kompienga. The policeman was arrested and then shot and killed.[223][224]
perpetrator: Al-Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb or Islamic State

details: Two Iraqi policemen were killed and another one was injured when a bomb struck their security patrol in the Arar border area of Iraq with Saudi Arabia, Islamic State claimed responsibility.[225][226]

A policeman was killed and four others were injured when gunmen opened fire on them after being stopped at a checkpoint in Rawalpindi. The Hizbul Ahrar group claimed responsibility for the attack.[227][228]

Six people were killed and at least 20 were wounded in two car bombings in the rebel held areas of Afrin and Jarabulus. The first attack was a car bomb in Afrin which killed a 10-year-old girl and injured 20 others. The second car bombing occurred in Jarabulus as four Turkish-backed rebels tried to defuse a car bomb and it exploded while defusing it. The attacks are believed to have been done by the YPG.[229][230]

20 people were killed when a car bomb exploded near a minibus of the Kurdish self-defense force and oil workers; among the dead were also oil workers. A number of other people were also left critically injured in the attack which occurred in the town of Al-Shuhayl. The Islamic State was behind the attack.[231][232]

A man's head was discovered after he went missing three days ago in the mountainous area of Sidi Bouzid province. The body is yet to be found and the person is believed to have been beheaded by ISIS militants, the Islamic State group claimed responsibility and said that the man killed was a spy, the group also claimed booby trapping the area around the body.[233][234]

A caravan of workers of the oil company of Anadarko was attacked by gunmen in the Mocimboa De Praia District, resulting in the death of a contractor who was beheaded and the injuries of six people. The attack is believed to have been done by the same group doing attacks since October 2017.[235][236]
Maoists attacked and burnt vehicles and construction equipment on a bridge between Lodhi and Kodwa villages of Gomia block.[237]
Al-Shabaab attacked a Somali military base, but were repulsed. Al-Shabaab clashed with military for over an hour, leading to heavy casualties per eyewitnesses.[238]
Mansoya-Orito pipeline in Puerto Asís municipality of Putumayo department was bombed overnight which the Colombian army blamed on FARC dissidents.[239][240]
Two units of Mexibús were torched in Ecatepec. The Individualistas Tendiendo a lo Salvaje group is suspected being behind it by the police.[241]

A person was killed and two others were injured in a bombing which occurred outside of an office of the private telecom company Ncell in the Lalitpur District. The blast had also damaged and shattered the windows of other buildings in the area nearby. No group claimed responsibility but the police arrested six people.[242]
Four people were killed, 7 were left missing, and another one was left severely injured in a Boko Haram attack on the hamlet of Garin-Amadou, near the village of Bosso.[243][244]
Five fishermen were shot dead by Islamic State militants on the banks of Lake Tharthar. Their corpses were blown up while their cars were burnt by the attackers.[245]

Boko Haram carried out series of attacks around election day. Per security sources, attempt to infiltrate Maiduguri was repelled. Attacks on Nigerian Army's 7th Division Headquarters, Maimalri barracks and shelling on Teachers Village were reported, killing 1 and injuring 20. The army and Borno's police commissioner however denied any attack, though ISWAP claimed responsibility and also showed a video of it attacking Maiduguri airport and Nigerian military targets. Three people were injured in a rocket attack in Gwoza LGA. Boko Haram also clashed in Auno and attacked Zabarmari a day before.[246][247][248]

Islamic State attacked police outposts in al-Namil village south of Shirqat around midnight, killing a policeman and injuring another. They were later repelled by Iraqi forces, who killed three attackers.[249]

Six Syrian soldiers including two officers were killed in an ambush attack by the Islamic State in an area located between northeast of Palmyra and northwest of al-Sukhnah, three soldiers were also kidnapped in the attack.[250]
A Somali lawmaker identified as Osman Elmi Boqore was shot and killed by gunmen in the city of Mogadishu. The attack was blamed on Al-Shabaab.[251][252]
Boko Haram carried out series of attack on election day. The army stated they attacked Geidam, though there were no casualties. Clashes also took place in Goniri on the border with Borno.[253][254]
Three soldiers were injured when a bomb placed near the wall of Golden Arrow School, exploded in the Mirali Sub division. The Hizbul Ahrar group claimed responsibility for the attack.[255]

Four people were beheaded and 20 others were injured in attacks in Mozambique's Cabo Delgado province, in one attack the people were beheaded after being shot dead, the attackers are believed to belong to a group called "Ahlu Sunnah Wa-Jama".[256]
In a sabotaging action on a military vehicle transporting Firqat Al-Hamzat terrorists three people died. The attack was carried out by the Afrin Liberation Forces.[257]
A motorbike rigged with explosives exploded in Al-Sa'a square of Idlib city, killing one and injuring several others.[258][259]
A person was killed and 11 were injured when an explosive laden motorbike detonated in Dera Murad Jamali.[260]
Twelve soldiers were killed and 60 other people were injured when Houthis fired a missile at a popular market in the town of Al-Buqa, Saada Province.[261]

A government worker was killed and another one was injured when multiple gunmen opened fire on them while they were on their way to a hostel, the attackers used silencer weapons. The attack occurred in the Afghan border town of Torkham, which borders Pakistan. No group has claimed responsibility yet.[262][263]

Two officers and a soldier belonging to the Syrian Army were killed when a landmine exploded in the area of Al-Shoula, south of Deir ez-Zor city. The landmine had been placed by Islamic State militants.[264]

location: Beni, Democratic Republic of the Congo
details: Two civilians were killed in a raid by members of the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF), the militants burnt homes and a health care center as well as looting shops, kiosks and animals. The incident occurred in the Mamove, Beni territory.[265]

Two suicide car bombers tried to attack a EU training base in Koulikoro, the attack was foiled and two attackers were killed, one of the vehicles was stopped at the gate and burnt down while the other one detonated. A rocket was also fired at the gate of the base, three Malian troops were injured in the attack, no foreign troops were injured in the attack, and the Al-Qaeda branch in Mali (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the attack.[266][267]

Islamic State militants attacked the Sayf Saad village in Kirkuk province by firing rocket-propelled grenades at the village. Although the villagers resisted, a villager was left injured and another one was left missing and is believed to have been kidnapped by the militants.[268]
The Afrin Liberation Forces attacked a bus with Turkish state allied terrorists. The vehicle was burned down. There were casualties, but it's unknown how many.[269]
The Afrin Liberation Forces attacked a checkpoint of Qewat El-Nuxbe terrorists. In the clashes that broke out our people got killed.[270]
NPA attacked and burnt a hydropower plant in Naujan, Oriental Mindoro, burning its equipment and stealing other objects.[271]
Three members of the Popular Mobilization Forces were left injured when their vehicle struck a bomb placed by Islamic State militants in the al-Tharthar area in northern Ramadi.[272]
Nine street cleaners were shot dead and seven others were injured when they were targeted by Al-Shabaab gunmen in the Lafole area of the Lower Shabelle.[273][274]
Suspected Fulani gunmen attacked several villages of Kajuru LGA, killing 29 Adara people and burning around 40 houses in a suspected retaliation for the 2019 Kaduna State massacre.[275][276]

Three construction workers were killed and three others wounded when a bomb exploded near a bus carrying the construction workers in the al-Nuaimiya area near Fallujah. The bomb had been placed by Islamic State militants.[277][278]
A ranger was killed and two others including a passerby were injured when a bomb hidden in grass struck their patrol in the Yala Province. The attack was blamed on "Insurgents".[279]

Seventeen people were killed and around three others were injured when a booby trapped corpse of a man who had been kidnapped days before was found, in the Gondogourou, close to the town of Koro. The corpse exploded while the relatives were burying the man. According to a source, this is a method that jihadists use; most of attacks like these are attributed to pro Al-Qaeda groups.[280][281]

Three GATIA members were killed and four others wounded in a shooting and ambush attack on a GATIA patrol in the Ndaki area of Gao Region. Gatia also claimed to have killed nine attackers and recovering six motorcycles. The attack may have been done by militants belonging to the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS).[282]

Two civilians and a policeman were injured when a magnetic bomb attached to a police pickup exploded in the city of Jalalabad. No group claimed responsibility, but the Taliban and the Islamic State are active in the province.[283]
A policeman was killed when Islamic State militants attacked the Alas oilfield near Kirkuk. The attack, however, was mostly warded off because the militants planned to take over the field.[284]
ELN tried to shoot down a civilian helicopter in Valdivia of Antioquia Department, however was no one was injured according to the ColombianArmy.[285]

Two policemen were kidnapped from a teashop by 10 armed men and then their bodies were discovered a day after in a ditch with gunshot wounds to the head and torso in the Narathiwat Province. The incident could be a retaliation from insurgents for the death of two insurgents in an area nearby in February 11.[286]

A Pakistani High Court Judge in Peshawar was injured when gunmen opened gunfire on the vehicle; the driver was also injured in the attack. The Tehrik-i-Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.[287][288][289]

Two policemen were killed and two others were injured when vehicles in a police convoy struck a mine in the Ponnagyun Township. The blasts were followed by 20 minutes of gunfire. Police blamed the attack on the Arakan Army (AA).[290][291]
Two Iraqi civilians were killed and four others wounded in mortar shelling by Islamic State militants in the al-Jadida Village, south Baqubah.[292][293]

Two people were killed and two others were injured when gunmen hurled grenades at an internet cafe in Mogadishu. No group claimed responsibility for the attack but Al-Shabaab has done attacks like these.[294]
Three Kenyan soldiers were killed in an ambush and bomb attack on a Kenyan army vehicle in the region of Gedo. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.[295]
The Afrin Liberation Forces carried out a sabotaging attack against Sultan Murad terrorists nearby Sînka village. Two terrorists became injured.[296]
The Afrin Liberation Forces carried out a sabotaging attack against Firqa Tas terrorists. One terrorist was killed in the attack.[297]
The Afrin Liberation Forces attacked a military vehicle with Ahrar al-Sham terrorists. The vehicle was destroyed and three people got killed.[298]

type: Suicide car bombings, shooting, grenade attack
details: 28 February 2019 Mogadishu bombings: At least 29 people were killed and 80 others were injured when in two suicide car bomb blasts near a hotel in a busy street Mogadishu. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. the sound of gunfire and grenade explosions were reported in buildings near the attack and Al-Shabaab attackers are believed to be holed up in the place and a gunfight also ensued between the security forces and the attackers the next day on March 1.[299][300]
Four people were killed and 26 others were injured when a car bomb exploded near the Mosul university in central Mosul. The Islamic State is believed to have been behind the attack.[301][302][303]

A police officer was killed and two others were wounded when militants opened gunfire on the police unit in District 4 of Kandahar city. Another militant was arrested in the attack. No group claimed responsibility but the area was a former Taliban stronghold.[304]

Four people including three soldiers and a civilian were killed and dozens of others sustained injuries when Boko Haram attacked Kardamari, headquarters of Jere Local Government. A pursuit ensued and "many" terrorists were said to have been killed.[305][306]

Two soldiers were killed and two other people including a civilian were injured in an ambush and shooting attack in Datu Salibo by suspected members of the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters. Another incident occurred in Cotabato where a soldier was killed, although this incident according to early investigations was due to a personal grudge.[307][308]
Five policemen were killed when the Taliban stormed a security outpost in the northern Afghan province of Balkh.[309]
Militants belonging to Tahrir-al-Sham shelled with mortars and missiles the city of Aleppo, no one was killed or injured, although damage was done to some buildings in the area.[310]
NPA members torched heavy construction equipment in Alcala, Cagayan.[311]
The Caño Limón–Coveñas pipeline was bombed by ELN in Saravena municipality of Arauca Department.[312][313]

A mass grave was found 10 days ago according to SDF's spokesman Adnan Afrin on 28 February. It contained dozens of bodies, including of men and women while heads were also found in the grave. The SDF was trying to confirm whether they were Yazidis and Islamic State members. A video of Furat FM showed a mass-grave. The outlet's executive said that most corpses were apparently shot in the head. SDF spokeswoman Lilwa Abdulla confirmed they found large number of Yazidi bodies though there was no specific number.[314][315][316][317] Locals have however said the corpses were victims of airstrikes.[318]

23 Afghan soldiers were killed and 15 wounded, while 20 Taliban militants were killed when they launched a complex attack on the Shorab military base in the Helmand Province. Several other hostages were taken during the attack and one of the attackers detonated in a dining room.[1][2]
15 security forces were killed and 15 others were wounded when the Taliban attacked security posts in Faryab's Qaysar district. Several Taliban were also killed in the clashes.[3]

Eight people were killed, including six jihadists, and 22 were wounded when a suicide bomber detonated at a restaurant in the Syrian city of Idlib. Hayyat Tahrir al-Sham's media wing "Ebaa" stated the bomber belonged to the Islamic State group.[4][5]
Nine Malian soldiers were killed and a number of others wounded when a roadside bomb struck the vehicle that they were traveling on in Boulkessi in the Mopti region.[6][7]

A soldier was left injured when a landmine exploded in Mount Orbat in the Gafsa Province. The soldier was transmitted to a hospital in Tunis via a military plane. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.[8][9]

Iraqi security forces discovered the bodies of 5 civilians who had been earlier kidnapped by Islamic State militants. The bodies were discovered riddled with bullets to the southeast of the town of Rutbah, in the Anbar desert.[10]
Two people were wounded when ELN members triggered explosives on the road between Saravena and Fortul in Arauca Department meant for soldiers who escaped unhurt and disarmed another bomb.[11]
An Iraqi policeman was killed when an explosive device went off in Kirkuk's Hawija District.[12]
Two people were left wounded when 5 mortar shells rained down on the presidential palace in Mogadishu. Damage was done to the compound and Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.[13]
Two soldiers were injured when an explosive device went off in the city of Beledweyne. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.[14][15][16]
A civilian was left injured when an IED exploded in Kashmir's Tral. The IED was placed by militants to target security officers vehicle; however, the IED exploded prematurely.[17][18]
A member of the Syrian Democratic Forces was shot dead in Al-Shuhayl. The SDF has blamed Islamic State cells for being behind it.[19]

Four members of the SDF were found killed by a sharp tool in a water lifting station near the city of Al-Busayrah. The SDF has blamed Islamic State of being behind the assassinations. A motorbike also exploded near cars of SDF passing through the entrance of the city, though there was no information about casualties.[20][21]

A vehicle of the Syrian Democratic Forces in al-Sabha town was shot at, resulting in the death of a SDF commander and 3 others accompanying him while others also received injuries. The SDF has blamed Islamic State of being behind the assassinations.[22][23]

A suicide bomber belonging to the Islamic State shot at three tribal dignitaries during a meeting between the Syrian Democratic Forces and tribes in Jadeedat Al-Khabur village of Al-Karamah, later blowing himself up. The attack killed 4 people including, 3 dignitaries and a SDF commander, whilst injuring 12 others.[24][25]

Five civilians and a soldier were killed by armed assailants in Goma city of North Kivu. Witnesses and the MP as well as the provincial deputy Jean-Paul Lumbulu have suspected FDLR. A civilian was also kidnapped.[26]
perpetrator: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (suspected)

details: An off-duty soldier was killed in Datu Odin Sinsuat, Maguindanao. BIFF claimed responsibility of the attack as retaliation for the deaths of its members[27]

27 Syrian soldiers were killed in an attack launched by the pro Al-Qaeda group Ansar al-Tawhid. The attack occurred in the province of Hama. Five assailants were also killed in the attack.[28][29][30]
Six Syrian soldiers were killed in an attack launched by HTS militants in the Latakia Province.[31]
Gunmen believed to be Islamic State members shot at a checkpoint of Syrian Democratic Forces in Al-Busayrah, killing two SDF members and injuring others.[32]

Eight policemen were killed and 7 others were wounded when the Taliban stormed their checkposts in Balkh's Dawlatabad District. The attack began when the Taliban stormed checkposts in the district, killing 1 and injuring two. Reinforcements of policemen sent to the area were later ambushed and 7 were killed with 5 wounded. The Taliban also had casualties in the attack, but the number was not confirmed.[33]
A rigged motorbike exploded in the town of Qabasin, resulting in injuries.[34]

Three civilians including two children were injured when an explosive rigged motorbike exploded near a bus terminal at the Mall Road area in Chaman. No group has claimed responsibility yet for the attack.[35]
Taliban attacked the market of Yangi Qala District. The police spokesman of the province said seven were injured and two killed, while a local official said three were killed.[36]
Taliban attacked a government checkpoint in Imam Sahib District, killing ten and injuring around the same number according to the governor.[37]

Two Israel Defense Forces soldiers were injured in a ramming attack near Kafr Ni'ma. Two Palestinian attackers were killed and another injured. IDF announced that the investigation had shown it was a terror attack and they had firebombed an intersection earlier.[38]
1 person was killed and 11 were injured due to an explosion in a market of Taiz Governorate; a medic said it occurred due to a bomb.[39]

3 civilians were killed and 6 others injured when Houthis targeted their home in Al Mugailes, located in  Al Tuhaiyta district in the south of Al Hudaydah city. The family said their home was deliberately attacked.[40][41]

Militants crossed over from Afghanistan and attacked a Pakistani security post by opening gunfire on the post, the attack was reported to be repelled by the army and no casualties were reported in the attack. An area nearby is said to be a safe haven for Jamaat-ul-Ahrar terrorists.[42]

As part of Islamic State's revenge attacks and threats, an SDF member was assassinated by unidentified men on a motorbike in Swidan Jazira area. A number of SDF were injured when an IED exploded in their vehicle in Jammah. Two former IS members who were kidnapped from village of Hawija few days ago were found burnt along the Deir Ezzor–Hasaka road.[43]

A Wolesi Jirga candidate was killed when a magnetic bomb exploded in his vehicle in the city of Kandahar. Also in Kandahar, a border police commander and his bodyguard were killed in a targeted attack. No group has claimed responsibility yet for the attacks.[44][45]

Two guards were injured when a radicalized prisoner stabbed them with a ceramic knife when he was with his wife in Condé-sur-Sarthe. The attacker and his wife then barricaded in at the family unit; afterwards, the police stormed the place and killed the woman and injured the attacker, who was identified as Michael Chiolo.[46][47][48]
Eight civilians were injured when an explosive rigged motorbike exploded in a busy street in the town of Al-Bab.[49]

A Cano Limon pipeline was damaged when a bomb exploded in the municipality of Saravena. The pipeline was not pumping at the time of the attack and the oil that spilled was contained and left behind by the explosion. A military source said that ELN rebels were to blame for the attack, which is the 10th bombing on the pipeline this year.[50]

Four parcel bombs were sent to Waterloo railway station, Heathrow Airport, London City Airport and University of Glasgow. No one got injured by the packages. One bomb created a small fire after opening. The missing fifth bomb was found at 22 March at an Irish post office. An Irish republican dissident group known as the new IRA has claimed responsibility.[51][52]

A suicide bomber attacked a building company near the Jalalabad Airport. Later, four militants attacked the area killing, 16 people and wounding 10. All five attackers were killed. The Islamic State has claimed responsibility for the attack.[53][54]
A bomb struck policemen in al-Tawakol village located in north of Miqdadiyah town. One policeman was killed and three others injured. The Islamic State group is suspected for the attack.[55]

A knifeman tried to stab a group of police officers in Port Olimpic, a touristic zone of Barcelona. The attacker shouted "Allahu Akbar" when he was neutralized and being detained by the police.[56][57][58]

Ten security personnel, including two soldiers were killed and 12 others were injured when the Taliban stormed their checkpoints in the Qalay-I-Zal District of Kunduz. After taking over the checkpoints, the Taliban were pushed back. There was no information about the casualties of the Taliban during the attack.[59]
Seven members of the pro-government militia of Popular Mobilization Forces were killed and 30 others were injured when Islamic State militants ambushed them in the area of Makhmur.[60][61]
Five farmers were killed and 20 injured when a mine planted by ISWAP exploded near their truck outside the town of Addamari/Khaddamari area in Borno State.[62][63]

Eleven people were killed and 95 others wounded in a mortar shelling attack at a gathering commemorating the death anniversary of Shia leader Abdul Ali Mazari. The Islamic State has claimed responsibility for the attack. Two attackers were killed and another one was arrested by the police.[64][65][66]

Two people were killed including a teenager and 32 others were wounded when a grenade was thrown and exploded at a bus stand in the city of Jammu. A suspect was arrested and the police blamed Hizbul Mujahideen for the attack.[67][68]

Five people were killed and nine others were injured when a car bomb detonated outside a restaurant frequented by government soldiers. The Al-Shabaab group claimed responsibility for the incident.[69][70]

Three soldiers were killed by militants when the soldiers were guarding the construction of a major highway in the Nduga Regency. A rebel was also killed in the attack, although reports say that more rebels were killed in the shootout. The attackers had also used traditional weapons like bows and spears.[71]
Five soldiers were injured when they were attacked with explosives in the municipality of Fortul. The attack was blamed on an ELN front.[72]
A policeman was killed when an sniper shot at him in the Yousef al-Haylan village in the province of Diyala. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for this incident.[73][74]

A policeman was killed and 5 other people were left injured when gunmen opened fire on a police patrol in KhorMaksar district of Aden. No group claimed responsibility but the security source blamed it on extremist groups.[75]
A SDF member was killed in the town of Abu Hardub. The Islamic Sate was blamed.[76]

Militants driving a pick-up truck disguised in electricians' work clothes opened fire on a checkpoint of security forces in the southern part of the city. One police officer was wounded, and three attackers were killed. The militants were planning to plant a bomb in Giza.The government said the militants were part of the Hasm Movement.[77]
Two SDF members were  killed in the town of Abu Hardub. The Islamic Sate was blamed and the attackers were heard shouting “Allahu Akbar”.[78]

Two people, including a child, were killed and 10 others were injured when a car bomb was detonated outside a restaurant in the Iraqi city of Mosul. Attacks like these are often blamed on the Islamic State, although there was no claim of responsibility.[79][80]

Three people were killed and another one was injured when a bike bomb exploded in Jarabulus as the explosive experts tried to defuse the bomb but failed. Security forces of the Free Syrian Army suspect YPG could be behind the attack.[81]

Three security officers were killed and three others wounded when the Taliban attacked them in Farah's Anar Dara District. Reports said that there were a large amount of soldiers also captured and there was no information of Taliban casualties.[82]
Four civilians were injured when gunmen on motorcycles hurled a grenade towards a security patrol in the area of Saravena. Police suspect that Farc or ELN could be behind the attack.[83][84]

Seven Nigerien soldiers were killed and 38 Boko Haram terrorists were killed when Boko Haram attacked the outskirts of the village of Gueskerou, the attack according to the defense ministry was mostly repelled with the army seizing many vehicles, weapons and ammunition from the militants.[85]

location: Beni, Democratic Republic of the Congo
details: Six civilians were killed when suspected fighters of the Allied Democratic Forces attacked the town of Lubwasi near Beni. Some victims were killed by machete while others with guns and some were even burned while also 8 houses and health facility were set on fire by the assailants.[86]
Two Iraqi paramilitary fighters were killed when a bomb targeted their patrol in the Jurf Al Nasr area southwest of Baghdad.[87]
Six Syrian soldiers were killed and two others were captured when they were ambushed by Islamic State militants in the Western desert area of Homs province.[88]

location: Butembo, Democratic Republic of the Congo
details: An Ebola treatment facility in Butembo was attacked by Mai-Mai militants, killing a policeman and injuring a health worker who is receiving treatment in the hospital. An attacker was managed to be captured by the army and police.[89]

Nine policemen were killed, another one was injured and another one was left missing when Arakan Army militants attacked their outpost in the Yoetayoke village in Ponnagyun Township in Rakhine State.[90][91]
A policeman was killed and another one was injured when gunmen opened fire on patrols in the area of Corinto, Cauca Department. The attack was attributed to FARC dissidents.[92]
Three soldiers were killed and two other civilians were killed when they stepped on an area full of explosives in the Tibú area. The authorities blamed ELN guerrillas for the attack.[93][94][95]
Eight people were wounded when a suicide bomber blew up a car in the Syrian town of Manbij, near a market. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.[96][97]
At a flyer hand out event of the PVV, the police arrested a man armed with an axe and two knives before he could attack Geert Wilders. The identity of the arrested man is unknown.[98]

A former Islamic State official was seriously injured in an assassination in Swidan Jazira. A SDF checkpoint near Al-Shuhayl was attacked, without any reports of injuries. Two SDF members were shot dead near Al-Suwar and three injured over a period of 24 hours, as part of Islamic State's revenge operations.[99][100]
A series of small bombings shook the provinces of Satun and Phatthalung in Saturday evening and Sunday morning. No one was killed or injured in the attacks.[101]
An explosives expert was killed and another six paramilitary fighters were injured when they tried to refuse a bomb that had been placed by Islamic State militants in the area near Baiji.[102]

15 French soldiers were injured including two severely when Islamic State militants attempted a complex attack against the forces in the area of Akabar, Mali. The attack begun when the French forces saw an SVBIED and opened fire on it causing a premature loud explosion then 15 Islamic State militants on motorcycles opened fire while the french forces did not manage to intercept the bikers.[103][104]
A suicide bomber attacked the Shuwa community in Madagali area, killing himself and also a resident of the area.[105]

20 Afghan security forces were killed and 10 others were wounded when the Taliban attacked a security outpost in Bala Murghab district. 28 other soldiers are said to have been captured during the attack.[106]
A member of the Syrian Democratic Forces was shot dead in outskirts of Al-Busayrah, as part of Islamic State’s revenge operations.[107]
A policeman was killed and another one was injured in an ambush attack in Motiong, Samar, by members of the New People's Army.[108][109]

Maoists killed a road construction supervisor in Malkangiri by slitting his throat after they barged into a construction camp and dragged him and threatened him at gunpoint. Two vehicles were also set on fire by the militants.[110][111]
A ranger was injured when a roadside bomb exploded in the Cho-airong District of Narathiwat.[112]
Four policemen were injured when a bike bomb was detonated near a police vehicle in Mianghundi, Balochistan.[113]
A local journalist was injured and lost his leg when a bomb attached to his vehicle exploded in the city of Lashkargah.[114]

Seven Malian soldiers were killed when two vehicles struck IEDs in the areas of Hombori and Dialloube in the Mopti Region groups aligned to Al-Qaeda regularly stage attacks against soldiers in areas like these.[115][116]
Militants attacked Syrian Army checkpoint using two suicide bombers, killing a soldier and injuring 4 others in the area near Mhardeh.[117][118]
A police commissioner was shot and killed by gunmen in the Banh District. The area has seen numerous attacks by militants with an State of Emergency declared in December 2018.[119] [120]
Islamic State cells assassinated two SDF members and a local council chief in Al-Busayrah as part of their revenge operations.[121]
A bombing on an SDF post in the town of Abu Hardub killed and injured several of its members. The Islamic State claimed responsibility.[122][123]
Militants of Jaish-e-Mohammed shot and killed a former Special Police Officer in the Pulwama District.[124][125]

Eight people were killed and 40 others were injured when a bomb exploded at a livestock market in the Gof-Gadud village in the Bay Region. The attack is believed to have been done by Al-Shabaab because the people in the market refused to pay the group.[126][127]

An IED struck an African Troop Vehicle in the Arbaco area near Mogadishu. It is not clear how many casualties were in the attack and no group has claimed responsibility although Al-Shabaab has done attacks similar to these.[128]
A bombing took place in Manbij without leaving any casualties and only causing material loss. The Islamic State group claimed responsibility.[129][130]
Unidentified gunmen attacked an Asayish convoy in Raqqa, injuring 4 of them. The gunmen are suspected to be either pro-Assad elements or Islamic State cells.[131]
A policeman was killed and 6 civilians were injured when Islamic State militants shelled with mortars the area of the Qarah Tabbah district.[132]
A truffle hunter was executed by Islamic State militants in the district of Ar-Rutbah, 23 days after he was kidnapped.[133]
A person was killed in the town of Theban by gunmen believed to be of the Islamic State.[134]

Two people were killed and 7 others were injured an explosive rigged motorbike exploded near a market in the district of Pangjur. The massive blast also destroyed two vehicles and damaged six nearby shops.[135][136]

A car bomb attack left an army captain and several others killed in the area of Tomour, Niger. The Pro-Islamic State wing of Boko Haram (ISWAP) claimed responsibility for the attack; the group also claimed targeting the Diffa airport with Grad rockets.[137]
A civilian was killed and 13 others when an explosive device went of in a Bazaar in the Sawki (Chawkay) District of Kunar Province.[138]
Two militiamen belonging to the Popular Mobilization Forces were killed in an Islamic State attack in the village of Mahouz in western Kirkuk Province.[139]

Two rockets fired from Gaza Strip entered the Tel Aviv area and falling in an open area causing no damage or injuries. Hamas and Islamic Jihad rejected responsibility, although the Israeli Army blamed the attack on Hamas.[140][141]

Three civilians were killed when Boko Haram launched an attack on the town of Sandawadjiri in the night of Thursday-Friday. The attackers also burned houses and looted cattle from the civilians.[142][143]
13 people were killed by suspected jihadists in Thursday-Friday in the area of Mocimboa da Praia, more than 120 homes were destroyed in the attacks.[144]
A local TV journalist was killed in an armed attacked by gunmen in the city of Khost, Afghanistan.[145]

Christchurch mosque shootings: At 13:40 NZDT, a self-described "Ethno-nationalist, Eco-fascist" terrorist who wrote a manifesto named after The Great Replacement conspiracy theory opened fire on worshipers attending Friday Prayer at Al Noor Mosque and Linwood Islamic Centre in Christchurch, New Zealand livestreaming the attack on Facebook Live, killing 50 people and wounding 50 others.[146][147] Multiple improvised explosive devices were uncovered by police, and successfully disarmed by the New Zealand Defense Force.[148][149]
Three ISIS suicide bombers hidden among people who wanted to leave their last redoubt killed six people who were going out of their Baghuz Village and left several SDF fighters injured.[151]
A member of an ISIS cell targeted members of the Syrian Democratic Forces in Al-Shuhayl town using a gun, killing 3 and injuring several others.[152]
A person was killed and another one was injured when an IED exploded in the Kot e Sangi area of Kabul. No group has claimed responsibility yet for the attack.[153][154]
Two civilians and two security commanders were killed when a hidden IED exploded in Kandahar's Arghandab district.[155]
Two Burkinabe security forces were killed when their vehicle struck an improvised explosive device during a patrol in the Gourma Province.[156]

Three Afghan National Army soldiers were killed and three others were injured when an IED targeted their vehicle in the Qala-e-Qazi locality on the outskirts of Ghazni City. The attack was blamed on Taliban.[157]

22 people were killed and 20 others were injured when the Taliban launched attacks on checkpoints manned by pro-government forces in the areas of Qaysar District. The gun battle also lasted until Sunday.[158][159]
One person was stabbed in a "far-right inspired" attack in Surrey, United Kingdom. The incident was later declared as terrorism related by police.[160]

During protests of the Yellow vests movement several cars and 80 stores were set on fire/vandalised and some looted. Among the protestors were also Anarchists. 192 people got arrested and 60 others were injured, including 18 policemen and firefighters.[161][162]

A Jewish vendor and his son were stabbed by a man at the Albert Cuyp Market. The stabber is a man from Egypt, who recently came back from the Middle East. The man behaved strangely against the victims after he returned.[163]

Four people were killed and 10 others were injured when a bomb exploded on a train track in the Nasirabad District of Balochistan, Pakistan. Separatist rebels have done attacks on trains before in the past.[164]
Five civilians were injured when a bomb attached to a sedan exploded at a traffic circle at the city of Puli Khumri in Baghlan.[165]

A child was killed and five other people including a civilian and several pro-government militamen were injured when a bomb exploded near a shrine in the Khogyani District. The Taliban was blamed for the attack.[165]

Two people, including a rabbi, were killed when a Palestinian gunman opened gunfire after fatally stabbing a soldier in the area of Ariel. Another soldier was seriously injured in the attack.[166][167]

At least 23 Malian soldiers were killed when suspect Jihadists briefly seized a military base in Mali's Dioura, five military vehicles were also destroyed in the attack. The area has been over run in the past by groups related to Al-Qaeda.[168][169]
A SDF member was killed and others were wounded when Islamic State cells shot at their vehicle in town of Al-Tayanah.[170]

2019 Utrecht shooting: A man started shooting at random people in a tram. Three people died and three others got seriously injured. Four people also got light injuries. One of the injured died of his injuries ten days later.[171] The police arrested the 37 year old Turkish suspect later on the same day.[172][173] Dutch prosecutors confirmed three days later that the attacker had a terrorist motive.[174]
Eight people were killed and seven others were injured when a civilian vehicle part of a convoy struck a roadside bomb in the area of Gwoza. Boko Haram was blamed for the attack.[175][176]
Three people were killed when Boko Haram attacked the town of Michika. The terrorists also looted and burnt a bank before reportedly being pushed out by soldiers.[177]
Two Iraqi soldiers were killed and six others were injured in two bomb attacks in the area of Tarmiyah. The Islamic State was most likely behind the attack.[178]

Five people including two foreigners were killed in an armed attack in the area of the Nejo District in Oromia. Fighters of the Oromo Liberation Front have been accused of doing similar attacks on civilians on the past.[179]
Two children were killed when an explosive device detonated in the al-Tarfaya village in Diyala Province. The Islamic State was most likely behind the attack.[180]

location: Beni Territory, Democratic Republic of the Congo
details: Militants belonging to the Allied Democratic Forces looted a health center and several other houses during an attack in the area of Maleki in Beni territory, no one was killed or injured in the attack.[181]
Three pro-government militiamen were killed and a fourth one was wounded when their vehicle was ambushed by Islamic State/Daesh gunmen in the Al-Hewlat village in Kirkuk province.[182]
Six policemen were killed when Pakistani Taliban militants attacked a checkpoint in the mountainous Sanjawi area of Ziarat district. The attackers then fled after the attack.[183][184]
A soldier was killed and four others were injured in a bomb attack by ELN militants in the area of El Tarra.[185]

An Italian school bus driver with Senegalese origins took 51 children hostage in his bus. He let the teachers tie their hands, and he stole their phones. The man set the bus on fire trying to kill all the persons in the bus. He did this because he was angry about all the African immigrants that died in the Mediterranean Sea. The police was on time to rescue everyone from the burning bus.[186][187]

A suicide bomber struck the village of Chinar during Nowruz celebrations in the province of Kandahar, killing a person and injuring 4 others. No group has claimed responsibility although the Taliban has presence in the area.[188]
Six people were killed and 23 others were injured when three bombs exploded across Kabul during Nowruz celebrations. The Islamic State group claimed responsibility for the attack.[189][190]
Five people belonging to the National Defence Forces were executed by Islamic State militants while they were looking for truffles in the southern desert of Deir-ez Zor.[191]
Two policemen were wounded when militants hurled a grenade at their patrol in the Warpora village of Sopore town.[192]
Five mosques were attacked with a sledgehammer in Birmingham. The next day the police arrested two man on suspicion of racially aggravated criminal damage.[193]
Eight civilians were killed and 20 others were injured when Boko Haram attacked them with knives in the Dewa Kargueri, Gueskerou commune close to Nigeria in the Diffa Region.[194]

23 Chadian soldiers were killed when they came under attack by militants belonging to Boko Haram after they crossed from Neighboring Niger into the area of the town of Dangdala in the banks of Lake Chad.[195][196]
A Somali civil engineer was killed when explosives put in his car exploded in the city of Mogadishu. Al-Shabaab is suspected for the attack.[197]
Five Kenyan soldiers were killed on Friday by Al-Shabaab while they were on their way to the town of El Wak in Somalia.[198]

A Pakistani religious scholar was attacked by gunmen on motorcycles, killing two of his guards and injuring two others. The scholar escaped unhurt from the attack. No group has claimed responsibility yet for the attack.[199]
A civilian was killed and another one was wounded when Islamic State militants opened fire on them while they were collecting truffles west of the town of Baiji in the Saladin Province.[200]
A person was killed and another one was wounded when Islamic State militants opened gunfire on them while they were searching for truffles in the west of Ramadi, Anbar Province.[201]

At least seven people were killed when Boko Haram carried out several raids in the area of Diffa bordering Niger. The attackers also abducted two women burned a market and several houses. A report posted on Facebook by a group named Alternative Espace Citoyen said 11 people had been killed in the attacks.[202][203]
A vehicle carrying an NBC crew struck an IED in Baghuz, killing the driver while the rest of the crew were unharmed.[204][205]
Four people were killed and 31 others were wounded when bombs exploded during a celebration in a stadium with nearly a thousand people. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.[206][207]

15 people were killed, including the deputy labor minister, when Al-Shabaab gunmen set of a suicide car bomb attack and shooting attack on a government building in the city of Mogadishu. 20 others were wounded in the attack in which 5 attackers participated.[208][209]

160 Fulani Herders were killed in an attack launched on the villages, Ogossagou and Welingara near the town of Bankass. The attackers were dressed as Dozo Hunters and the attack appeared to have been ethnically motivated.[210][211][212]
65 Afghan security forces were killed and 38 others were wounded when a group of Taliban militants attacked their posts in the Sangin District.[213]
Two armed forces members were wounded in a bomb attack in the area of Fortul. The ELN or Farc dissidents are suspected for the attack.[214]
Suspected Al-Qaeda gunmen blew up a security headquarter in the Shibam District using a large quantity of explosives, there were no casualties in the attack.[215]
A policeman was killed when an IED exploded on his vehicle in a village in the Daquq district. The explosive device had been planted by ISIL/Daesh militants.[216]

A member of University staff was killed and another one was injured in a bomb explosion in the city of Mogadishu. No group claimed responsibility, but the attack was a latest of series of attacks claimed by Al-Shabaab.[217]
Suspected members of the Islamic State killed a civilian and kidnapped 3 after raiding their houses in the town of Ghadwa in Southern Libya.[218]
Seven US-Backed forces were killed when Islamic State sleeper cells attacked their checkpoint around midnight in the city of Manbij.[219][220]
An Iraqi soldier was gunned down by an Islamic State sniper in the outskirts of the Qarah Tapah district in Diyala Governorate.[221]

10 people were killed and 7–8 were wounded when Boko Haram attacked the town of N'guigmi in Niger's Diffa Region. The attackers used two suicide bombers and then shot at the civilians as well as burning many homes.[222]

A woman was killed and 6 others were injured when a mortar fired by insurgents landed on a market in the Shirin Tagab District of Faryab. No group, including the Taliban, has claimed responsibility yet.[223]
Two people were killed when Boko Haram attacked a military base outside the village of Miringa in the Borno State. The attackers burnt the base, a vehicle and also a primary school.[224][225]

15 people were killed when a car bomb exploded outside a restaurant in the capital city of Mogadishu. No group claimed responsibility, but the attack bore similarity of attacks done by Al-Shabaab.[226][227]
Five policemen were killed and 2 others wounded when the Taliban attacked a checkpoint in the Kajaki district of Helmand. The attackers then fled after the attack.[228]
Five policemen were killed and 7 others were injured in Taliban attacks in the Surai District of Zabul.[229]

Four policemen were killed in an attack on a base in the town of Barani in the Kossi Province. The attack also resulted in major material damage and a burnt vehicle. Most of these attacks are attributed to Al-Qaeda groups.[230][231]
Two members of the Syrian Democratic Forces were killed when a car bomb exploded as the vehicle was passing by in the town of Theban. The Islamic State group is believed to be behind the attack.[232]

Nine policemen were killed and six others were injured when the Taliban stormed a checkpoint in the city of Ghazni and then ambushed a group of policemen who were arriving to the scene. Among the dead was the head of the local police.[233][234]
Islamic State militants stormed the Sheikh Mahmoud village near Daquq and opened fire on a group of civilians killing 1 and injuring another one; the attackers then fled.[235]
Two fishermen were shot and killed by Islamic State militants in an island of the Tigris river near the Hammam al-Alil area.[236]

The Afghan Vice President's convoy was attacked by the Taliban resulting in the killing of one of his bodyguards and the injury of two others. The attack occurred in the Balkh Province while he was on his way to the Jawzjan province.[237][238]
Two policemen were killed and another one was injured when Islamic State militants attacked a patrol late Saturday in the Balad District.[239]

Three civilians were shot and killed in a vehicle in Jihadist attack on the town of Yendere in Burkina Faso. Two of the attackers were also killed by the security forces, similar attacks have been done by the pro Al-Qaeda group of JNIM.[240]
Suspected militants shot and killed a civilian in the Baramulla District, no group has yet claimed responsibility for the attack and a case has been registered.[241][242]
A Turkish soldier was killed and another one was wounded in a mortar attack in the area of Afrin in North Syria.[243]
Two Iraqi soldiers were wounded when an explosive device targeted their vehicle in the Sheikh Tami village located in Diyala.[1]
Boko Haram militants set on fire several houses and looted a village in the area of Chibok.[2]
Five people including 3 civilian militia members were executed and filmed on video by the Islamic State backed faction of Boko Haram.[3]
Eight policemen were killed in a Taliban attack on a checkpoint in the Sholgara District of the northern Balkh Province. The Taliban was blamed for the attack.[4][5]
A French military doctor was killed and two others were injured when an explosive device detonated on his vehicle in the Gourma Region.[6][7]

Two Yemeni soldiers were killed and a number of others were injured when their vehicle struck a roadside bomb in the Seiyun district of Hadramout province. No group has yet claimed responsibility or been blamed for the attack.[8]
A policeman was killed and 3 others were left wounded in an attack by militants in the Jalawla district of Diyala Governorate.[9]
62 people were killed in attacks by terrorists militants and subsequent communal clashes due to the attacks in the town of Arbina in North Burkina Faso.[10]
In Shalipora village of Kulgam District, Abdul Majeed, a panch, was shot and injured by suspected militants. He died the next day in a hospital. The victim was associated with the PDP.[11]

30 soldiers were killed and around 22 others were wounded in Taliban attacks on the Bala Murghab district in the Baghdis province of Afghanistan. Some early reports also said that air support also caused heavy casualties to the Taliban during the incidents, although other reports said no reinforcements had arrived in the area.[12][13]
Five policemen were killed and another one was wounded when Islamic State militants ambushed and opened fire on a patrol carrying the policemen near the area of Daquq.[14]
Seven people were wounded when a car bomb exploded outside a police academy in the capital of Somalia, Mogadishu. The Al-Shabaab group claimed responsibility for the attack.[15][16]
Five civilians including a child were wounded when a bomb exploded outside a bus in the Afghan city of Jalalabad. No group has claimed responsibility for this attack yet.[17]
Four Border Security Force (BSF) personnel were killed and two others injured in an encounter with Communists in a dense forest area near Mahla village in Kanker District of Chhattisgarh.[18][19]
A civilian was killed and 18 others were wounded when an explosive device went off outside a health complex in the city of Puli Khumri. No group has claimed responsibility for this attack yet.[17]
Two traders were killed by Al-Shabaab militants while the traders were ferrying goods to the Merca town in Lower Shabelle.[20]
Three civilians were killed and another one was wounded when a booby trapped vehicle placed by Islamic State militants blew up when truffle hunters tried to open the vehicle in the Anbar Desert.[21]

A Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) trooper was killed and another injured in an encounter with Maoists in the forest under Saleghat area near Chameda village in Dhamtari District of Chhattisgarh.[22]
Two Border policemen were shot and killed at a mosque after gunmen entered the mosque in the Than To District. The attack is suspected to have been done by Southern Insurgents.[23][24]
The Taliban attacked checkpoint in the Sari Pul province killing 4 policemen and injuring 5 others in the attack.[25]
The Taliban attacked checkpoints in the Ghazni province killing 5 policemen and injuring 7 others, while 7 Taliban were killed in a gun battle that ensued.[25][26]
An off duty army man was shot and killed by militants in the Sopore district in Kashmir after he was returning home.[27]

Two members of a civilian militia and a civilian were killed while 45 others were wounded, when two female suicide bombers detonated their explosives in the Muna Dalti settlement in Maiduguri. Boko Haram is suspected for the attack.[28][29]
Three soldiers were killed and 4 others were wounded when the Islamic State faction of Boko Haram attacked a post in the area of Fotokol in Cameroon in the night of Saturday to Sunday.[30]
Three civilians were killed and 19 others were wounded when two explosives were detonated at district 4 of the city of Jalalabad.[31][32]
Five people were killed and 16 others were wounded when jihadists fired rockets at the city of Masyaf in Hama Province. The attack occurred hours after an attack by Tahrir al Sham was foiled.[33]
Five civilians were injured when a bomb was detonated in the Afghan city of Jalalabad.[34][32]

An IED targeted a vehicle of the Syrian Democratic Forces in the Abu Al Hasan village in the Deir ez-Zor province, killing 3 and injuring a number of others. The attacks are believed to be done by ISIS sleeper cells.[35]
20 Afghan soldiers were killed and 8 others were injured when the Taliban launched attacks on checkpoints in the Shorabak District.[36][37]

Four Americans including three soldiers and a contractor were killed while three others were wounded when their convoy struck a roadside bomb near the base in Bagram. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.[38][39]

Two people were killed and 5 were wounded when an IED attached to a military vehicle exploded in the Afghan city of Jalalabad. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for this attack and other attacks done in Jalalabad in days before.[40][41][32]
Unidentified militants killed Kameel Karimi, the representative of Afghanistan Taekwondo Federation, in Kunduz city of Kunduz province.[42]

Seven people including officers and civilians were killed and 26 others were injured when a suicide bomber targeted a market in the town of Sheikh Zuweid in the Sinai, the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.[43][44]

Eight people including four civilians and four members of the Syrian Democratic Forces were killed and 3 officers were wounded in a double car bomb attack in Raqqa. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.[45][46]

Gunmen believed to be of the Islamic State attacked the town of Fuqaha in Libya killing three people including the mayor and kidnapping another one, the attackers also burnt several homes during the attack.[47][48]
A Rashtriya Swayamsewak Sangh leader and his security officer were shot and killed by militants in the town of Kishtwar in Jammu and Kashmir province.[49]

An Iraqi soldier was killed and two others were injured when an explosive device targeted their vehicle at Ibrahim el-Mazkour village on the outskirts of Buhriz. No group claimed responsibility but the Islamic State group is mostly responsible for attacks like these.[50]
A civilian was killed and two policemen were injured when a bomb was detonated on a police vehicle in the city of Asadabad. The Taliban was blamed for the attack.[51]
A BJP legislator and four of his security personnel were killed when their convoy was attacked with a bomb and following gunfire by Maoists in the Dantewada District.[52][53]
A Tribal fighter was killed and two others were injured when Islamic State militants attacked their checkpoint near Fallujah in Al-Anbar.[54]
